Es la novena vez  que  tiene un crédito, y agradece  a todas las personas que hicieron posible el  préstamo, pues  le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio.Alicia tiene pensado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de utensilios de cocina, que necesita para sus servicios de  banquetes (grandes eventos sociales) que últimamente  esta ofreciendo en su restaurante.
texts.en:
Alicia, who is 46 years old, lives with her husband and her son in a rented house. For 22 years, she has sold food in her rural restaurant which she built in her house. Her great talent and calling in the kitchen have succeeded in attracting the most demanding palates of her customers, who come in to her restaurant every day to eat the different typical dishes of her region which she prepares. In her work, she relies on the support of two young women whom she has hired to wait on the public, while she prepares the food and administers the premises. The length of her experience has permitted her to see the profitability of her business, since she has succeeded in supporting herself without experiencing economic difficulties.

In the future she plans to expand and improve the infrastructure of her business. This is the ninth time that she has had a loan, and she is grateful to all the people who made the loan possible, since it will be very useful in the progress of her business. Alicia is thinking of investing the money requested in the purchase of kitchen utensils, which she needs for her banquet services (for big social events), which she has recently been offering in her restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cooking utensils for her restaurant

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy products and ingredients to prepare more meals

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley N. is a hardworking entrepreneur who has been in business for almost three years. She is the married mother of three grown-children. Her husband is a driver in the community while she manages her own variety store to supply additional income for the family.

Shirley would like to receive a loan of 13,000 PHP as working capital for her variety store to fund added groceries for her store. A proud member since 2007 of Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva micro-finance partner in the Philippines, Shirley has been a dedicated member with regular attendance at weekly center meetings and solid repayments on previous loans.

Shirley’s longterm goals are to build her own home. Also, she hopes the profits from her business will fund continued education for all her grandchildren. With the support of ASHI and Kiva lenders, Shirley is determined to achieve a winning business and to build more longterm financial security for herself and her family.

loans.use: To fund the purchase of added groceries for her store

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La Sra. María tiene 44 años, es soltera tiene 2 hijos menores de edad, ambos cursan la educación primaria.
Posee una despensa en su domicilio, con una antigüedad de 10 años aproximadamente, se inicio con la venta de bebidas en frente a su domicilio, luego de a poco cargo un pequeño kiosko que  fue creciendo, actualmente tiene buena clientela y un buen inventario de mercaderías.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de mercaderías tales como: azúcar, yerba, fideos, panificados y bebidas en general.
texts.en:
Sra. María is 44 years old, single, and has two dependent children who are in elementary school. She runs a food pantry out of her home and has approximately ten years of experience in this business. María started selling drinks in front of her house, but she later set up a small kiosk that continued to grow. She currently has a good clientele and a sufficient inventory of merchandise.

María is requesting a loan to buy merchandise such as sugar, herbs, noodles, baked goods, and beverages.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sugar, herbs, noodles, baked goods, and beverages

loans.name: Thierno Bocar

texts.fr: Monsieur Thierno Bocar N. est un jeune commerçant  de 27 ans qui habite dans la localité de Baye Laye à Guediawaye. Il est sociétaire  de la caisse de l’U-IMCEC depuis septembre 2009.Il a déjà bénéficié  d’un prêt antérieur. Il a démarré  son activité de commerce en tenant une table  devant chez lui. Mais par la suite il s’est oriente vers le commerce de denrées en gérant  une boutique d’alimentation générale. Il capitalise une expérience  de 13 ans dans son activité. Les moments les plus intéressants  de son commerce coïncident  avec les week-ends et les fins de mois. Monsieur N. sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs pour renforcer ses marchandises et augmenter son fond de roulement. Son objectif est de satisfaire le maximum aux besoins de sa clientèle.  Ainsi son prêt lui permettra d’augmenter son offre de  produits et de maximiser ses bénéfices  de sorte qu’il sera en mesure de mieux faire face aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Thiemo Bocar N. is a young businessman, who is 27 years old and lives in the town of Baye Laye in Guediawaye. He has been a member-shareholder of the U-IMCEC savings institution since September 2009. He has already benefited from a loan. He began his commercial activity on a table in front of his home. However, he then turned to the food business managing a general grocery store. He has built up an experience of 13 years in this business. The most interesting times in his business are the weekends and the end of the month. Mr. N. is applying for a loan of 500,000 francs to build up his stock of goods and increase his working capital. His aim is to satisfy customer demand to the maximum. His loan will allow him to increase his product offer and maximise his profits so that he will be able to provide better for his family's needs.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Arly Antonio

texts.es: Don Arly, vive en la comarca Sabana Grande, de edad de 34 años, gracias a muchos esfuerzos logro poner su propio negocio de fabrica textil, que junto con su esposa se apoyan mutuamente ya que ella es costurera, procreo tres hijos los cuales cursan sus estudios. El señor Arly ahora esta trabajando de Mecánico Industrial por que las ventas están bajas, y  hay pocas entradas,  es por eso decide volver a trabajar para equilibrar los gastos de su familia y poder seguir organizándose para mantener su pequeño negocio. Su casa es de concreto pero falta aun repellar, poner piso ya que aun es de suelo, pintar. Pero este financiamiento lo quiere para comenzar hacer el porche para lograr mejor tener mejor comodidad y mas sombra. Lo cual comprara: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro, zinc para comenzar la obra. Sus planes es lograr seguir invirtiendo en su negocio para tener mejores beneficios.
texts.en:
Don Arly lives in the Sabana Grande district. He is 34 years old. Thanks to much effort, he succeeded in setting up his own business, a textile factory, which helps both him and his wife, since she is a seamstress. They have three children, who are in school. Señor Arly is now working as an industrial mechanic because sales are low and there is little income. For this reason, he decided to return to work to balance the family expenses and to be able to continue to organize himself to maintain their little business.

His house is made of concrete but it is still lacking a plaster finish, a floor, and painting. But he wants this loan to begin making the porch, to be more comfortable and have more shade. He will buy stones, sand, cement, iron, and zinc to begin the work. His plan is to be able to continue investing in his business to have better profits.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to begin building the porch

loans.name: Milciades Edmundo

texts.es:
El señor Milciades Edmundo B. P., tiene la edad de 56 años, vive en el Barrio El Rodeo, es casado y su esposa se dedica al comercio, ellos tienen 9 hijos de los cuales los mayores trabajan y le brindan un apoyo económico a sus padres y los menores actualmente estudian la primaria, ellos se dedican a la agricultura desde hace 26 años.

Cultivan café, y dentro de los obstáculos que han tenido a lo largo de su laboriosa actividad es la afectación de las plagas que amenazan con la producción, es por esta razón que ellos solicitan de un préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas y material vegetativo que salvaguarde la cosecha y permita nuevas inversiones que favorezcan económicamente a la familia. Ellos comenzaron sus días en este rubro gracias al apoyo de la reforma agraria de los años 1979 cuando comenzaba la revolución política de los años 80's. Ellos esperan se les brinde un apoyo económico para continuar con la mejoría que se ha venido dando desde años atrás.
texts.en:
Milciades Edmundo B. P., 56, lives in the El Rodeo neighborhood; he is married and his wife is a merchant. They have been farmers for over 26 years. They have 9 children, the oldest of whom work and contribute to the economic support of their parents, and the youngest are in elementary school. They are coffee growers. Among the difficulties they have faced along their long work history is the pests that threaten their crops. For this reason, they are asking for funding to buy fertilizers, fungicides and other farming supplies that will safeguard the crops and allow for new investments that will be of economic benefit for the family. They started off in this line of work thanks to the Agrarian Reform laws of 1979 at the beginning of the political revolution of the 1980s. They hope that the loan will be approved so that they can continue the improvement that has been taking place these last years.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. L. Martinez se dedica a la elaboración de calzado, es padre de 4 hijos todos en edad escolar. Este negocio le ha ayudado a sacar adelante a sus hijos en sus estudios el cual tiene 32 años de ejercer esta actividad, el crédito que solicita con CEPRODEL lo quiere para la compra de tela azulón, suela, pega amarilla y blanca, cuero y Brasil. Con la ganancia de esta inversión el Sr. Martinez quiere ofrecerle mayor bienestar a su familia, para que tenga un futuro estable.
texts.en:
Mr. Lopez is a shoemaker and has been doing this for 32 years. He is the father of four school-aged children. This business has helped move him move ahead with his children and their education. He is asking for this loan through CEPRODEL in order to buy cloth, soles, yellow and white glue and leather. With this investment he hopes to be able offer his family a better life and a stable future.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies

loans.name: Javier Ernesto

texts.es:
El señor Javier Ernesto D. O., es trabajador de la Alcaldía de Chinandega se desempaña como Electricista, es Acompañado y habita en la colonia gracsa.

El señor Javier D. solicito el crédito para repara el techo de su casa y poner piso. Lleva ya dos créditos con ceprodel y ha demostrado ser una persona responsable.
texts.en:
Javier works as an electrician in the Chinandega city hall. He is married and lives in the Gracsa neighborhood. He is requesting this loan in order to repair the roof on his home and install a floor. He has had two previous loans with CEPRODEL and he has proven to be a responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home repair

loans.name: Braulia

texts.es:
Braulio es natural D. la ciudad D. Yucay, tiene 64 años, tiene siete hijos D. las cuales seis son independientes pero también tiene una hija adoptiva, ella es una madre responsable que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus menores hijos. 

Braulia es enfermera jubilada  trabajó 25 años para la posta D. salud D. la ciudad D. Quillabamba y actualmente se dedica a  la venta D. verduras como por zanahorias, cebolla china, etc. Ella lleva sus productos a vender los días martes, jueves y sábados a la ciudad del Cusco.  

Braulia requiere el préstamo para comprar verduras y frutas como por ejemplo, zapallo, papas, cebollas, platanos, naranjas, etc.  

Braulia pertenece al banco comunal “Reyna D. los Ángeles”, ella es una D. las fundadoras del banco comunal. El anhelo D. la socia es que su hija Mercedes que estudio la carrera profesional D. turismo en al Universidad Nacional San Antonio Abad del Cusco se gradué en el mes D. Junio.  

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Braulio is a native of the city of Yucay. She is 64 years old, and she has seven children. Six of them are independent. She also has an adopted daughter. She is a responsible mother who is looking every minute for opportunities to get ahead. She uses her daily effort to give her minor children a better future. Braulia is a retired nurse. She worked for 25 years for the Health Post in the city of Quillabamba. She currently sells vegetables like carrots and green onions, etc. She takes her products to the city of Cusco to sell on Tuesdays, Thursdays, and Saturdays. Braulia needs the loan to buy vegetables and fruit like zucchini, potatoes, onions, bananas, and oranges, etc. Braulia belongs to the Reyna D. los Ángeles Communal Bank. She is one of the founders of the communal bank. Her wish is for her daughter, Mercedes, who studied the professional career of tourism in the San Antonio Abad National University of Cusco, to graduate in June. She is grateful for the opportunity of the loan, and she promises to pay it on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy vegetables and fruit like zucchini, potatoes, onions, bananas, and oranges, etc.

loans.name: N'kéchi

texts.fr: M. N'Kéchi est née le 16 Août 1982. C'est une divorcée qui a à sa charge trois enfants, dont deux sont ses enfants. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. N'Kéchi vit seule avec ses enfants au quartier Aïbatin à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, depuis deux ans. C'est elle seule qui assure les différentes charges de ses enfants. N'Kéchi a fréquenté l'école jusqu'au cours secondaire. Après son abandon, N'Kéchi a commencé, il y a six ans, la vente de divers articles (couscous, pâtes alimentaires, savons, papiers hygiéniques, conserves, sucre, farine de manioc, etc.) dans sa boutique à Aïbatin. De façon secondaire, N'Kéchi vend des tissus (hitarget et des bazins). N'Kéchi s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et à Lomé au Togo. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant obtenu auparavant, quatre crédits qui ont été tous bien remboursés. Face à la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de sa clientèle, N'Kéchi sollicite un cinquième prêt, afin de renforcer son activité et de mieux répondre aux multiples demandes de la clientèle.
texts.en:
N'Kéchi M. was born on 16th August 1982. She is a divorcée who has three children in her care, two of whom are her own. All the children are at school. N'Kéchi has lived alone with her children for the past two years in the Aïbatin neighborhood of Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. She alone covers the various expenses of her children. N'kéchi attended school up until secondary level. Once she left school, she started six years ago selling various items (couscous, pasta, soaps, toilet paper, canned foods, sugar, cassava flour, etc.) in her shop in Aïbatan. As a secondary activity, N'kéchi sells fabrics (hitarget and damask fabrics). She gets her supplies in Dantokpa, Bénin's international market, and in Lomé in Togo. She is an old customer of ALIDé having already had four loans, which she repaid without incident. Faced with ever increasing customer demand, N'kéchi is applying for a fifth loan in order to strengthen her business and better respond to the multiple demands of her customers.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various products (canned foods, pasta, soaps, mayonnaise, Possotomé mineral water, etc.)

loans.name: Carlos Enrique

texts.es:
Carlos García de 47 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Paraíso de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, su esposa vende dulces ellos tienen 3 hijos de 17, 13, 7 años. 

Carlos aprendió desde pequeño el oficio de maestro constructor pero al crecer como no tenía suficiente ingresos decidió invertir sus pequeños ahorros en dulces y venderlos a sus vecinos. 

El sigue ejerciendo el oficio de maestro constructor pero en ocasiones también atiende su pequeño puesto de dulces con su esposa. Vende caramelos a $ 0.10, chupetes a $ 0.25, etc. Uno de sus oídos ya no le funciona y le es de dificultad para atender su puesto de dulces. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cemento y piedra para poder el mismo construir mejor su casa. En el futuro quiere tener su casa de dos pisos y que sus hijos sigan estudiando.
texts.en:
Carlos García, 47, lives in a periurban area of Paraíso de Guayaquil; his house is cement and has all basic utilities; his wife sells candy and they have three children, who are 17, 13 and 7 years of age, respectively. Carlos learned how to work in construction when he was a young boy but, as he got older, he saw that this work did not produce enough income so he decided to invest his meager savings in candy to sell to his neighbors. He still works in construction but sometimes also tends to his wife’s small candy stand. He sells candies for $0.10, lollypops for $0.25, etc. He can’t hear in one ear and this is a problem for him in tending to his candy stand. He will use the funds to buy cement and gravel so that he can make some improvements to his home. In the future, he’d like to have a two-storey house and have his children continue with their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa’s long term goals are to build sustainable businesses and to fund her five children’s college education.  With the support of ASHI and Kiva, she is hopeful that her businesses will generate steady income to improve her financial stability and her family’s quality of life.

In 2009, Theresa joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines. When she received her previous loans, she invested the money in buying and selling of RTW (ready-to-wear-clothes) and later expanded the business with more inventory. For supplementary income, she is also embarked in an Electronic Loading business such as Smart load, Globe load, and Sun load.

Now on her 3rd loan, she requested 10,000 PHP as additional working capital for her E-load business. She is positive that her businesses will grow since she already has regular customers requesting orders from her RTW and solid clients of her E-loading business at home.

She dreams of having a permanent space in the marketplace where she can sell her RTW products as well as provide satisfactory E-loading to her customers. She hopes to have successful businesses that can provide her with a good life that is moving away from the poverty line. 

Theresa T. is a 47-year-old woman from town of Binangonan, Rizal Province in the Philippines. She is grateful to ASHI for offering her happiness in life and group support in achieving her goals.

loans.use: additional working capital for her E-load business.

loans.name: Félix

texts.es: Felix, de  34 años, vive con su madre y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia.Desde su niñez ha estado muy ligado a las tareas agrícolas, sembrando  diferentes  productos como  papa, maíz y zanahorias. En la actualidad sigue desempeñándose en esta tarea como herencia, que le dejaron sus padres, para lo cual contrata mano de obra que le ayuda a agilizar el proceso de siembra y cosecha. Sus productos naturales los comercializa  de acuerdo a las condiciones, ya sea de manera directa llevándolo él mismo al mercado o, sino también, por compradores que  adquieren  toda su cosecha. Paralelamente a esta actividad también realiza proyectos de construcción de los que  obtiene ingresos extras,  mientras espera pacientemente la época de cosecha para vender su producción. En el futuro tiene planeado mejorar su actividad agrícola pues comprará maquinarias para trabajar con mayor comodidad en menos tiempo.Es la tercera vez que tiene un crédito y promete que será  muy responsable en los  pagos de sus cuotas, además  agradece  a todas las  personas que hicieron posible  el préstamo ya que le permitirá continuar trabajando, en busca de un futuro mejor.Félix invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de abono y también pagara el alquiler de un tractor para sembrar, y con  otra parte comprará  madera para su negocio de proyectos de construcción.
texts.en:
Félix is 34, and he lives with his mother and his two children in his own house. Since his childhood he has been tied to farm work. He plants different products like potatoes, corn, and carrots. He is currently doing this work as an inheritance that his parents left him. He contracts field workers to help speed up the planting and harvesting process. He sells his natural products according to the conditions. It could be that he takes them directly to the market himself, or that buyers purchase all of his crops. At the same time he also does construction projects. This gives him extra income while he patiently waits for harvest time to sell his production. In the future he plans to improve his farming activity. He will buy machinery to work with greater comfort in less time. This is his third loan, and he promises to be very responsible about making his payments. Also, he is grateful to all of the people that make the loan possible because it allows him to continue working and looking for a better future. Félix will use the requested money to buy several bags of fertilizer. He will also pay to rent a tractor for planting. With the other part of the money he will buy wood for his business of construction projects.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer, wood, and rent a tractor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Juan Ramón

texts.es:
El Señor Juan Ramón M., es trabajador de la Alcaldía de Chinandega, se desempeña como vigilante habita en el barrio Carlos Fonseca, es acompañado y tiene un hijo en edad escolar.

El Juan Ramón M. , solicito el crédito para realizar unas reparaciones en su casa ya que poco a poco la ha hecho de concreto.
texts.en:
Juan works as a security guard at the Chinandega city hall in the Carlos Fonseca neighborhood. He is married and has a school-aged son. He is requesting this loan in order to be able to make some repairs to his home, which he has been doing little by little.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home repairs

loans.name: Irma Mariana

texts.es:
Irma Domínguez es socia del banco comunal Yanuncay,  vive en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca,  localidad muy reconocida por su exquisita gastronomía, su cultura, tradiciones, costumbres  y su gente muy cálida y amable,  nuestra socia tiene 50 años de edad, es casada y en su unión conyugal concibió tres  hijos que se encuentran de 25, 20, 16 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos estudian en la universidad y su ultima hija en el colegio Sagrados Corazones de la ciudad,  su esposo trabaja como profesor en una escuela del sector y por la tarde labora en una fábrica de ropa como agente vendedor, se siente orgullosa de tener su casa propia ya que es el esfuerzo y sacrificio de toda la  familia.

Irma  desde hace ocho años se dedica a la venta de ropa en un almacén ubicado en su casa, atiende  a partir de las 5 de la tarde hasta las 10 de la noche porque en la mañana trabaja  en el departamento de tesorería en el Ilustre Municipio de Cuenca hace ya 25 años;  se encuentra en su segundo ciclo laborando con la fundación, con el dinero del último crédito solicitado va a comprar pantalones, camisas, blusas, sacos y ropa interior para damas, caballeros y niños. 

Su meta es  incrementar su  almacén con  mas surtido de ropa  para toda la familia.
texts.en:
Irma Domínguez, 50, is a member of the Yanuncay communal bank. She lives in greater Cuenca, a region that is well known for its exquisite food, its culture, traditions, customs and its warm and kind residents. She is married and has three children, who are 25, 20 and 16 years of age. Her oldest two children are university students and her youngest daughter studies in the city’s Sagrados Corazones School. Her husband is a teacher in a local school and works afternoons as a sales agent for a clothing factory. She is proud that she owns her own home since it is the result of the entire family’s efforts and sacrifices. For the last 8 years, Irma has sold clothing in a store located in her home. She is open for business from 5-10pm because in the morning she is employed by the City of Cuenca’s treasury office; she has had this job for 25 years. This is her 2nd loan cycle with the foundation. She will use the funds to buy pants, shirts, blouses, coats and underwear for women, men and children. Her goal is to enlarge her store with more varied clothing for the entire family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing for women, men and children.

loans.name: Ebenezer #4 Group

texts.en:
Martin M. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Ebenezer #4.  He sells office supplies such as pens, pencils, paper, files, and calculators, and intends to use his portion of this 29,400 LRD group loan to buy more stock for his business.  

Martin is a 26-year-old high school graduate who is unmarried and has two children ages two and three who attend nursery school.  Martin sells from a table on Broad Street in downtown Monrovia, Liberia's capital.  He has had his business for more than five years, and says when he started out he sold flowers and cards, but moved to office supplies instead.

Martin says that sometimes he has problems with customers -- their manner of approach is not good.  The street which he sells from is often crowded and hectic.  He hopes one day to grow his business enough to open a proper shop.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Martin is the one holding the sign.  Jubi G. is inset at lower left.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

Join the Team LEAP - Liberia lending team on Kiva today: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=10019

loans.use: To buy more office supplies for resale.

loans.name: Union Con Esperanza 1,2,3 Group

texts.en:
Maireny is the coordinator of her group Union con Esperanza 1,2,3 (Union with Esperanza), and her story is not unlike others in  her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican community, many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti. Her group is located in Puerto Plata, a city on the north coast where the economy is based around tourism and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple, rented structure with her husband and two children.

Maireny is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza  after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling clothing and accessories by traveling to the larger markets in Santiago to purchase her goods and sell them in her local market at a profit. She will use the profits to save towards buying a plot of land where she can construct her own home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy clothing and accessories ofr selling.

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es:
El señor Miguel Ángel A. B., tiene la edad de 43 años, es casado y su esposa vende frutas y verduras en el mercado central, ellos son una familia de 3 hijos, el mayor les apoya en los trabajos del campo al señor A., y los otros menores estudian la escuela primaria. Ellos son agricultores desde hace 28 años, dentro de los frutos que cosechan esta la piña, café y plátano. 

Se ha ocasionado una erosión del terreno  en su finca,  gracias al exceso de escorrentías, ellos comenzaron sus actividades laboriosas, gracias al apoyo de la reforma agraria de los años 80's, es ahora que ellos solicitan, un préstamo para darle mantenimiento a sus terrenos, con el crédito compraría abono foliares y edáficos, esto con el objetivo de mejorar paulatinamente la erosión del terreno. Permitiéndole la diversificación a futuro de otras cosechas, que aportará mejores condiciones económicas que favorezcan a la familia entera.
texts.en:
Miguel Ángel A. B., 43, is married and his wife is a fruit merchant in the central market. They have been farmers for the past 28 years; they grow pineapple, coffee and banana. They have three children; the oldest helps Mr. A. with the farming chores and the two youngest are in elementary school. Their farmlands have suffered erosion due to excess water run-off. They began their farm work thanks to the Agrarian Reform laws of the 1980s. They are asking for funding now to do some soil maintenance work. They will buy various kinds of fertilizers and manure to gradually improve the eroded fields so that they can diversify crops in the future in order to provide improved economic benefits for the entire family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and manure.

loans.name: Olga Amalia

texts.es: La Sra. M. trabaja en el acilo de ancianos Hogar San Antonio, ella se encarga de brindarles cariño y ayuda a estas personas de la tercera edad, devenga un salario no alto pero la llena de satisfacción el poder atenderlos, ella es madre de 2 hijos quienes son menores de edad. Con esto le provee de su alimentación,  su vestuario y la poca comodidad que tiene. Se acerca a las oficinas de CEPRODEL para solicitar un crédito el cual utilizara para la compra de medicamentos, ya que unos de sus hijos lo tiene enfermo y el deseo de la Sra. M. es que su hijo este sano.
texts.en:
Ms. M. works in the “Hogar San Antonio” senior citizens’ center. She is in charge of caring and helping the elderly. She earns a small salary. It’s not very much, but being able to help people fills her with satisfaction. She has two young children. Her salary allows her to pay for food, clothing, and the few comforts that she has. She is requesting this loan through CEPRODEL which she will use to buy medicine for one of her children, who is sick and she wants him to be well.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Medicine for her son

loans.name: Carlos Javier

texts.es:
Carlos Javier M. tiene 22 años y vive en el barrio de Villa Aragón, que es un barrio muy tranquilo ubicado en el estrato 1 del Municipio de Soledad; él es un  joven soltero y emprendedor que se inició en el negocio de fabricación de mechas y traperos hace algo mas de 4 años. Con el propósito de comprar mayor volumen de sus materias primas en especial tiras de franela,  conos de algodón, e hilos, está pendiente de su segundo crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo  por valor de $2.000.000.
Comenzó con poca capacidad de producción, fabricando en pequeñas cantidades mechas de franela, de algodón y de hilo, pero poco a poco ha ido incrementando esa capacidad productiva, hasta el punto en que ahora es proveedor  de  depósitos y tiendas en la ciudad de Barranquilla y el municipio de Soledad, lo que hace que tenga una mayor exigencia de inyecciones de capital de trabajo para responder a estos mercados. 
 
Después del primero préstamo, ha tenido mayor capacidad de producción.   Pero, el negocio presenta constantes desafíos pues hay  veces que se escasea la materia prima y eso hace  difícil  la respuesta oportuna a sus clientes.  Como su negocio le exige  una nueva inyección económica para seguir aumentando su capacidad de producción, Carlos debe comprar al por mayor los insumos para conservar su inventario en época de escasez.   Carlos  quiere constituirse como una microempresa formal y así ampliará sus relaciones comerciales.
texts.en:
Carlos Javier M. is 22 years old and lives in Villa Aragón, a quiet neighborhood located in Stratum 1 [an urban area] of Soledad municipality. He is a young bachelor and an entrepreneur that four years ago began making mop heads and mops. With the purpose of purchasing more of his primary materials, especially flannel strips, cotton cones and string, he is waiting for his second loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for 2,000,000 COP. He began with a small production capacity, making small amounts of mop heads out of flannel strips, cotton and string. Little by little he has increased production capacity, up to the point that today he is a providor for depots and stores in Barranquilla and the Soledad municipality. This makes him have much need for injections of working capital to respond to these markets. After his first loan, he has increased production capacity. But the business presents constant challenges. There are times that he is short of primary materials and it makes responding to his customers quickly difficult. Because his business demands new economic inputs to continue increasing production, Carlos must buy wholesale inputs to conserve his inventory during periods of shortage. Carlos wants to become a formal small business and in this way expand his business connections.

Translated from Spanish by Flavia Garcia, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of more primary materials, especially flannel strips, cotton cones, and string

loans.name: My God Is Able Women Group

texts.en: For more than 10 years, Jaqueline J. has been selling fresh fish, chicken and meat at the Fiamah market in Monrovia, Liberia. She is 37 years old and single with two children, ages 12 and 15 years old. She did not continue her education through college, but she is now preparing to go back to college. Jaqueline sells quality goods at good prices which keeps customers returning but she has problems with few customers coming to buy. She started selling with 200 Liberian dollars (LRD) as working capital. She plans to use her 6,000 LRD portion of this 30,000 LRD group loan to purchase more pig feet, chicken and meat. Her goal is to own a cold storage unit and build a house for her children. Jaqueline is the leader of this group of five borrowers called "My God Is Able". In the photo that accompanies this profile, Jaqueline is the one holding the sign and Marian L. is inset at the lower right. About LEAP: The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, this non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase more pig feet, chicken and meat

loans.name: José Ruhdy

texts.es:
José es un padre de familia de 43 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a un hijo en el sector Tambo Real del distrito de Pítipo, ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar desde muy joven a la agricultura, actualmente posee un terreno de cultivo de una hectárea y media en el cual ha sembrado maíz, esta actividad es la principal fuente de ingreso familiar con la que cuenta por lo que trata siempre de dar lo mejor de si para sacar a su cultivo adelante. Adicionalmente José brinda servicio de yunta (arado impulsado por bueyes) las cuales alquila a sus vecinos para labores de labranza. Con estos ingresos el trata de sacar adelante a su familia.

José desea brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo de maíz, aplicándole abonos y foliares, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

José es un padre bastante trabajador y entregado a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es poder instalar un establo de producción lechera. El ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado responsabilidad y puntualidad al momento de asumir sus pagos. En la imagen aparece junto a los bueyes que posee para ofrecer servicio de yunta.
texts.en:
José is 43 years old and the father of a family. He lives with his wife and son in the Tambo Real sector in the Pítipo district, located 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. He’s been farming since he was very young and he now has a one and a half hectare plot of farmland, where he raises corn. This is the main source of income for his family, whom he depends on, so he gives his best to have a good harvest. José also offers oxen services (work provided by oxen) which he rents to his neighbors for farming tasks. He tries to move his family ahead with this income. José wants to maintain his corn crop by adding fertilizer, so he has seen the need to request a 2,000 PEN ($725) to help him meet his objective. José is a very hard working father, dedicated to his family. His greatest desire is to be able to add a dairy cow stable to his farm. He has worked with our institution in the past and has demonstrated that he is responsible and punctual with his payments. He appears in the photograph with the oxen he uses to provide oxen services.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Juana Francisca L. es soltero tiene dos hijos los dos estudia, vive junto a su familia en el barrio san Agustín, es trabajadora activa de la alcaldía municipal desde hace seis años como conserje en la intendencia del bisne  
La Juan Francisca L. tiene cuatro años de trabajar con ceprodel ha cancelado tres crédito demostrando responsabilidad, los créditos anterior obtenidos han sido muy importante ya que he mejorado mi casa brindando condiciones favorables a mi familia.
texts.en:
Juana is single and has two children. Both attend school. She lives with her family in the San Agustín neighborhood and works as a porter for the city hall. Juana has been working with CEPRODEL for the past four years and has had three prior loans. She has proven to be responsible and her previous loans have been very helpful and have allowed her to make improvements to her home, which has given her family a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building materials

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: Lidia, de  58 años, vive  con sus 2 hijos  en su casa que es propia.Desde hace 10 años, se dedica a la preparación de  platos típicos en su casa, acondicionada para un restaurante, trabaja con la ayuda de sus hijos. Los fines de semana son días donde mas se intensifican las  ventas, también  tiene  pedidos de su clientela para cubrir  banquetes en eventos sociales que se celebran en su ciudad como por ejemplo  fiestas de cumpleaños, recepciones y matrimonios. Aunque el trabajo es arduo en la preparación de los platillos pues  se requiere de mucha dedicación, para Lidia es una gran satisfacción trabajar en la cocina, pues la considera su pasión, además las ganancias que percibe, compensan su esfuerzo diario. Para el futuro se ha propuesto implementar  su cocina con mejores instrumentos.Es la octava vez que tiene un crédito y promete será  responsable con sus pagos, además  agradece  a las  personas que hicieron posible el  préstamo, pues  le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio.Lidia tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en mejorar el horno artesanal que utiliza en su cocina, también  quiere costear los gastos de empotrado de madera para su almacén, donde guardará sus instrumentos de cocina.
texts.en:
Lidia, age 58, lives with her 2 children in her own home. For the past 10 years, she has worked preparing typical local foods in her home, which has been set up as a restaurant. Her children help her in her work. Sales are strongest on the weekends, and they also receive orders from their customers to cater banquets for social events in the city, such as birthday parties, receptions and weddings. Although it is hard work preparing the food, because much dedication is required, it gives Lidia great satisfaction to work in the kitchen, since she considers it her passion. In addition, the profits she makes compensate for her daily efforts. For the future, she plans to equip her kitchen with better instruments. This is her eighth loan, and she promises to be responsible with her payments. In addition, she would like to thank everyone who has made this loan possible, since it will be very helpful for the progress of her business. Lidia plans to invest the funds she is requesting in improving the traditional oven she uses in her kitchen. She also wants to pay for built-in shelves for the storage area where she keeps her kitchen instruments.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improving her oven and having storage shelves built

loans.name: Assane

texts.fr: Monsieur Assane N. est sociétaire  de la caisse de Baye Laye depuis juin 2008. Il habite dans la localité de Baye-Laye plus particulièrement  dans le quartier de Touba Bagdad 2. Il est âgé de 29 ans, marie  et père de 03 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 8 mois et 9 ans. Il est tôlier  de profession mais il fait aussi de la mécanique  générale. Il a une expérience  de 5 ans dans la tôlerie. Monsieur N. est un analphabète qui est entre dans le métier  de tôlerie par son propre gré, sans aucune influence. C’est pendant la période d’hivernage qu’il gagne l maximum  en bénéfices  car il y’a beaucoup de panne de voitures. Il sollicite un crédit de 125 000 frs destine a l’achat de matériels  pour son atelier tels que générateur, chalimo, lime etc. Ce crédit lui permettra d’être plus productif dans son travail et de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Assane N. has been a shareholder-member of the savings institution in Baye-Laye since June 2008. He lives in the town of Baye-Laye, more specifically in the neighborhood of Touba Bagdad 2. He is 29 years old, married and father to three children, whose ages vary between eight months and 9 years old. He is by profession a sheet metal worker but also does general mechanics. He has five years experience in the sheet metal trade. Mr. N. is an illiterate who entered into the sheet metal profession not because of any influence, but because he liked it. He is able to maximise his profits in the winter because it is during this period that a lot of cars break down. He is applying for a loan of 125,000 francs to buy materials for his workshop such as a generator, blow-torch, files etc. This loan will allow him to be more productive in his work and to be able to provide better for his family's needs.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment

loans.name: Nubia Esther

texts.es:
Nubia I. González, vive en Costa hermosa con su esposo y sus tres hijos de 12, 14 y 16 años, ella es una mujer ejemplar y muy negociante, vende mercancía desde cuando tenia 10 años que su madre la impulsó y le enseñó este oficio, pues le gusta trabajar independiente y no se visualiza como empleada de una empresa; en la actualidad solicita un crédito por valor de $1.500.000, para unirlo a un ahorro que tiene y comprar artículos encargados como lavadora, planchas, aire acondicionado y víveres que venderá en proporción a las solicitudes realizadas por sus principales clientes, las amas de casa.
Ella desde hace mas de 10 años es conocida por la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo como una excelente cliente, pero se había ido a vivir a Bogotá y hasta hace dos años regresó a esta organización para continuar creciendo en su negocio; con los apoyos de capital de trabajo recibido ha podido aumentar su oferta de servicios, su clientela y por consiguiente la utilidad que ha reinvertido y con la que ha podido educar a sus hijos y aun comprarle  un computador, para que no se queden fuera de los avances tecnológicos. En la actualidad está muy feliz porque su esposo tiene un buen empleo en el Departamento del Cesar  y sabe que ahora con mayor apoyo podrá cumplir con su sueño de organizar un gran almacén pues él está dispuesto a apoyarla.
Se siente orgullosa de ser negociante,  porque ha crecido personalmente y con ello ha sacado adelante a su familia, sobre todo en épocas en que su esposo no estaba trabajando. También está agradecida con la Fundación y dice que piensa adquirir su vivienda en villas de San Pablo, al igual que su gran almacén y de poner a estudiar a su hijo en la universidad  los cuales son 3 grandes desafíos. Una de sus metas mas cercanas es la de comprar un enfriador nuevo, porque también vende refrescos, mariscos  que almacena en su nevera y ya le esta quedando pequeña para los requerimientos del mercado.
texts.en:
Nubia I. González lives with her husband and three children, 12, 14 and 15, in Costa Hermosa. She is an exemplary woman and very good in business. She has been selling merchandise for the last 10 years when her mother inspired her and showed her the business. She likes to work independently and doesn’t picture herself as an employee in a company. Currently she is requesting a loan of $1,500.00 to put together with some savings that she has and buy items that were requested, like a washing machine, irons, air-conditioning units, and supplies, that she will sell according to the requests by her main customers, housewives. 10 years ago she worked with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation and was an excellent client. But she had gone to live in Bogota and only two years ago returned to this organization to be able to help her business continue growing. With the working capital she has received, she has been able to increase the services she offers to her customers, and put the money into the business. She could take out enough to educate her children and even buy them a computer. She purchased this so that they would be knowledgeable about technological advances. Currently she is very happy because her husband has a good job in Cesar department and she knows that now, with more support, she can fulfill her dream of setting up a big store because he is ready to help her. She feels proud to be a businesswoman, because she has grown personally and has been able to help her family get ahead, especially in the periods when her husband wasn’t working. She is also grateful to the Foundation and says that she plans to build a house in the San Pablo development, along with her big store. Also she will send her son to the university. These are her three goals. One of her first needs is to buy a new refrigerator because she sells soft drinks and shellfish that she needs to store in the refrigeration. The one that she has is too small for the demands of the market. .

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy household domestic goods requested, such as a washing machine, irons, air-conditioning units and supplies.

loans.name: Help Together Group

texts.en: For over 19 years, Victoria K. has been selling fresh fish and charcoal in downtown Monrovia, Liberia. She is 43 years old, married, and has seven children who range in age from 9 to 25 years old. Victoria was only able to attend school through 8th grade because her mother passed away and there was no one else to support her. Victoria says that because she sells a variety of fresh fish, customers are attracted to her business. She plans to use her 10,000 Liberian dollar (LRD) portion of this 48,000 LRD group loan to buy more fish and charcoal. Victoria is the leader of this group of five borrowers called "Help Together". In the photo that accompanies this profile, Victoria is in the center of the photo. About LEAP: The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, this non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs and puts emphasis on lending to women. Join Team LEAP - Liberia lending team on Kiva today: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=10019

loans.use: To purchase more fish and charcoal

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is a 50-year-old single lady.  She rears dairy cattle and sells milk to the area residents to earn a living. She has been in this business since she was 20 years old.  She also earns rent from her residential houses to improve her living conditions.  She had previously taken out a loan of Kes 46,900 from Faulu Kenya, which she used to expand her business and successfully repaid.  She hopes to increase her turnover and improve her living standards in the future. She has requested a loan of Kes 40,000 to buy a dairy cow and dairy feed.

loans.use: To buy one dairy cow and feed

loans.name: Aziadekor

texts.fr: Né en 1960, T. Aziadekor vit depuis 30 ans au quartier Sainte Cécile à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Aziadekor est marié et a six enfants à sa charge, dont certains sont scolarisés. Parmi les six enfants, cinq sont ses propres enfants. Aziadekor supporte seul les différentes charges de ses enfants. Aziadekor n'a jamais été à l'école. Pour assurer ses besoins et ceux de ses enfants, Aziadekor exerce l'activité de la pêche depuis 35 ans environs. Aziadekor achète les filets de pêche et le bois ("acadja") au marché Dantokpa à Cotonou, et exerce son activité au lac de Cotonou. Aziadekor est un ancien client de ALIDé, ayant obtenu quatre fois déjà de crédits, crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. Aziadekor désire acquérir des matériaux de pêche beaucoup plus performents et mieux mener son activité ; ce qui lui permettra d'accroître son revenu. Pour cette raison, Aziadekor sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un autre prêt.
texts.en:
Born in 1960, Aziadekor T. has lived for 30 years in the Sainte Cécile neighborhood of Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. Aziadekor is married and has six kids in his care, some of whom are in school. Of the six children, five are biologically his. He alone takes care of the children's different expenses. Aziadekor has never been to school. He has fished for 35 years, to provide for his needs and for those of his children. He buys fish nets and wood (acadja) at the Dantokpa market in Cotounou, and does his work in a Cotonou lake. Aziadekor is an old client of Alidé, having already obtained four loans that have been repaid. He wants to purchase better fishing equipment to improve his work, which will allow him to increase profits. For this reason, Aziadeko asks for another loan from Alidé.

Translated from French by Flavia Garcia, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fish nets and acadja wood for fishing

loans.name: Maïmouna

texts.fr:
Madame Maïmouna Adjené est une femme mariée de 21 et mère de 2 enfants qui réside avec son époux et ses enfants dans le quartier Hérémakono Nord de la ville de  Bougouni troisième région administrative de la république du Mali.
Enseignante de carrière, elle mène en plus de cette activité, diverses autres activités génératrices de revenus telles, l’achat vente d’articles divers (pagnes wax, colliers) articles de fêtes (chaussures, parures)  et l’agriculture (la culture de salade, carottes, de chou, etc). 
Elle a une boutique dans laquelle elle fait le commerce général (pagnes, chaussures, pain, biscuits, parures etc), située dans le quartier Dialanicoro. Avec 2 années d’expérience dans cette activité de commerce général, elle est très sollicitée, envieux et appréciée à Bougouni.
Afin de satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus exigeantes, elle décida de rejoindre  le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est à son premier prêt individuel, pour acheter des pièces de pagnes wax et quelques paires de chaussures. Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale de république du Mali) auprès des grossistes.
Avec ce prêt elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 45.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour agrandir son entreprise.
texts.en:
Ms. Maïmouna Adjené is a 21-year-old married woman and the mother of two children. She resides with her husband and children in the Hérémakono Nord district of Bougouni City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Along with her career as a teacher, she runs this business, as well as a diversity of other income-generating activities, such as buying and selling various goods (wax pagnes cloth, necklaces), holiday items (shoes, accessories), and farming (salad greens, carrots, cabbage, etc.) She has a general store (pagnes cloth, shoes, bread, cookies, accessories, etc.) located in the Dialanicoro district. With two years of experience working in general commerce, she is in high demand, envied, and appreciated in Bougouni. In order to satisfy her more and more demanding customers, she decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program and is now on her first individual loan. This loan will be used to buy bolts of wax pagnes cloth and a few pairs of shoes. She gets her supplies in Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali) from wholesalers. With this loan, she envisions making a monthly profit of 45,000 francs CFA that will be used for expanding her enterprises.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying cloth and shoes

loans.name: Martín Antonio

texts.es: El Señor Martín R. es trabajador en el Centro Escolar Salesiano, en el que se desempeña como vigilante, con el salario que el tiene se logra mantener así como también a su nieta la que está en edad escolar y el prácticamente le provee para los gastos del colegio, el crédito que solicita a  CEPRODEL lo quiere para uso personal, ya que piensa hacer varias compras para él y su nieta.
texts.en:
Martín works as a security guard in the “Centro Escolar Salesiano” (Salesiano School Center). His salary allows him to support himself and his granddaughter. She is school aged and he pays for her education. He is requesting this loan through CEPRODEL for personal use. He needs to buy some things for his granddaughter.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Personal expenses

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Madame Fatoumata  Koné est âgée de 25 ans, mariée  et mère  de 2 enfants.  Elle  vit dans une famille traditionnelle  élargie avec sa grande sœur, belles sœurs, frères au quartier Darsalam de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas fréquenté l’école pour des raisons sociales, elle commença tôt le commerce auprès de sa sœur qui vendait des aliments et faisait de la coiffure. Après plusieurs années d’apprentissage, elle évolue seule en optant pour la préparation et la vente d’aliments. Elle mène cette activité depuis maintenant  5 ans et jouit d’une grande réputation et notoriété.
Pour faire du couscous à base de fonio appelé « Djouka », elle procède préalablement par bien laver le fonio et l’assécher à l’aide d’un torchon en soie.  Une fois  cette opération achevée, elle procède à la cuisson après avoir mis de la poudre d’arachide.
Dans le dessein d’augmenter son fonds de commerce, afin de réaliser plus de bénéfices, elle a fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est à son 1er  prêt individuel  qui sera utilisé  pour acheter, 2 sacs d’arachide et 5 sacs de fonio. 
Elle  s’approvisionne sur place et  vend ses plats alimentaires au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Avec ce prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 120.000FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permet d’aider son mari et de participer aux événements sociaux.
texts.en:
Ms. Fatoumata Koné is 25 year old, married, and the mother of two children. She lives in a traditional extended family with her older sister, sisters-in-law, and brothers in the Darsalam district of Ségou (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Not having attended school due to societal reasons, she soon began in commerce with her sister, who used to sell foodstuff and work in hairstyling. After several years of apprenticeship, she is advancing on her own by opting to make and sell food. She has been in this business for five years now and enjoys a great reputation and fame. To make fonio couscous, called djouka, she proceeds beforehand by washing the fonio (a millet-like grain) very well and drying it by using a silk towel. Once this operation is completed, she proceeds to cooking it after adding some peanut powder. With plans to increase her working capital, in order to make more profit, she turned toward the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and is now on her first individual loan, which will be used for buying two sacks of peanuts and five sacks of fonio. She gets her supplies locally, sells her prepared dishes, and accepts cash or credit from a customer base composed of women and men. With this loan, she envisions making a monthly profit of 120,000 francs CFA that will allow her to help her husband and to take part in societal events.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying ingredients for food catering

loans.name: María Delma

texts.es:
La señora María Delma Z. es una señora que a pesar de la edad que tiene es bien trabajadora, ella vende comida de diferentes clases en la sección de comideria del bisne, atiende desde las 7:00 am hasta 3:00 pm , habita en la ciudad de El viejo.

La señora María Delma Z. tiene tres hijos, pero todos son independientes, ella solicito el crédito con ceprodel para comprar productos por cantidad ya que así le dan mejores precios en carnes, pollo, granos básicos, etc, todo para la preparación de sus comidas y ofrecer buena calidad.
texts.en:
María is a hard worker in spite of her age. She sells different types of food in the food section of the market from 7:00 am to 3:00 pm. She lives in the city of El Viejo. María has three children, but they are all adults and on their own. She is requesting this loan through CEPRODEL in order to buy ingredients in bulk so that she can obtain better pricing on meats, poultry, basic grains, etc. She will use these ingredients to prepare her dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Meyling Guillermina

texts.es:
La joven Meyling Guillermina C. G. es trabajadora de la Alcaldía de Chinandega, se desempeña como auxiliar de contabilidad, pero actualmente está estudiando para ser contador público en león, por lo cual ella solicito el crédito para cubrir con el pago de la Matricula de su Universidad y dejar pagado unos meses por adelantado y de esta manera ayudarse.

La Joven Meyling C. es soltera y no tiene hijos, aun vive con sus padres, pero no depende de ellos.
texts.en:
Meyling works as an accountant’s assistant in the Chinandega city hall. She is also studying in Leon to be a certified public accountant. She is requesting this loan in order to be able to pay for her tuition in advance at the university. She is single with no children. She lives with her parents, but supports herself.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Tuition

loans.name: Colette

texts.fr: Née en 1960 à Ouidah, ville historique du Bénin, A. Colette est mariée à GANMADIGBE Léonard, un chauffeur. Il y a près de 25 ans que Colette vit à Sainte Rita à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, avec ses enfants et son mari. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et contribuer aux charges familiales, Colette vend divers produits (huile de palme et d'arachide, condiments de sauce, pâtes alimentaires, savons, couscous, bougies, papiers hygiéniques, etc.) à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Colette vend du maïs et du "sodabi" (boisson alcoolisée locale). C'est à Houègbo et à Comé au Bénin, que Colette achète ses produits. Colette a déjà obtenu auprès de ALIDé, trois crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. Colette sollicite un autre crédit afin d'accroître son activité et de reconstituer son stock de produits, pour mieux faire face aux exigences de la clientèle.
texts.en:
Born in 1960 in Ouidah, a historic village in Benin, Ms. A. Colette is married to Mr. GANMADIGBE Léonard, a driver. She has been living for 25 years in Sainte Rita in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, with her children and husband. To support herself and to take part in covering family expenses, Collette sells a variety of goods (palm oil, peanut oil, sauce condiments, pasta, soaps, couscous, candles, toilet paper, etc.) out of her home. Secondarily, she sells corn and sodabi (a local alcoholic drink). She buys her goods in Houègbo and in Comé, in Benin. She has already obtained three loans from ALIDé that she has repaid. Colette is requesting another loan in order to grow her business and to replenish a stock of products for coping better with the requirements of her customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying vegetable oil, palm oil, canned tomatoes, soaps, etc.

loans.name: Luisa Maria

texts.es:
Doña María, es una mujer muy dedicada al trabajo y a sus hijos, es comerciante de semi joyas Romannel, de venta de ropa y también tiene cabinas telefónicas, lleva en el negocio aproximadamente  15 años, se  inicio sola, primero vendía oro, en el negocio de las semijoyas se  incentivo por el hijo menor, ya con los dos niños mayores y el ultimo  se le hacía difícil viajar, al  enterarse que en Manta había venta de semi joyas se hizo parte de ese negocio, hasta la actualidad.

 Está  casada desde hace 23 años, tiene 3 hijos, dos mayores de edad y uno menor de edad, el negocio de las cabinas está instalado en la casa, al inicio lo maneja el mayor de sus hijos, ya que estaba por entrar en la universidad y opto porque él tenga su negocio para que se ayude en los estudios.

Las ventas de las joyas y ropa lo maneja ella, doña María trata de distribuir muy bien su tiempo, por ello en la mañana se dedica  a los que haceres del hogar  y en las tardes al negocio de joyas y ropa,  tiene sus clientes fijos y va adquiriendo nuevos clientes a medida que expande su negocio, la inversión en los negocios es según, lo de las joyas según sea el negocio las ventas y las compras, como tiene bastantes años, los proveedores  le facilitan para vender hasta que normalmente las ventas se hagan efectivas, es responsable, 

En las cabinas la inversión se basa solo en los chips, está feliz porque  con el nuevo crédito va a invertir  en mas ropa, por que se viene el mes de las madres, y sabe que se venderá mucho,  mas invierte en ropa para mujer, su sueño es seguir adelante, a ella le entusiasmo a formar parte del banquito una sobrina, por ahora está muy contenta con su negocio, porque es rentable, esta consiente que con el próximo crédito será todo mucho mejor.
texts.en:
María is very dedicated to her work and her children. She is a consultant for Rommanel jewelry (jewelry made with semi-precious stones), she sells clothing, and she also has a phone booth business. She has been in business for about 15 years. She began alone, selling gold jewelry. She was encouraged to get into sales of semi-precious jewelry because of her youngest child. With two older children and then the youngest one, it became difficult for her to travel, so when she found out about the semi-precious jewelry business in the city of Manta, she became part of the business and has continued with it until now. María has been married for 23 years. She has three children, two of them grown up and one still young. The phone business is set up in her house. In the beginning, her eldest son ran it since he was about to enter the university and chose to start this business to help him pay for his studies. María manages the jewelry and clothing sales herself. She tries to schedule her time well, so in the mornings she does the household chores and in the afternoons she sells jewelry and clothing. She has regular customers and is finding new customers as she expands her business. Her investment in the businesses is according to their needs. For the jewelry it is according to how the purchases and sales are going. Since she's been doing this for many years, the suppliers offer her credit until her sales are finalized. Although normally these sales must be paid in advance, the suppliers know she is responsible. For the phone booths, the investment is only for prepaid phone cards. She is happy because with the new loan she will invest in more clothing. Mother's Day is approaching, and she knows sales will be high, so she will invest in clothes for women. Her dream is to get ahead. A niece encouraged her to join the communal bank, and for now she is very happy with her business because it is profitable. She knows that with the next loan, everything will be much better.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of women's clothing

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es: Rocío tiene 34 años, es madre soltera y vive con sus 2 hijos, en su casa propia. Desde hace 15 años se dedica a la agricultura y la ganadería, cultiva principalmente alfalfa, que le sirve para alimentar a sus cuyes y vacas; y la ruda, que es una hierba aromática típica de su localidad. Tiene grandes extensiones de terreno en su  zona, heredados de sus padres, permitiéndole tener ingresos económicos. Desde entonces, cada 15 días sale a ver sus cultivos de ruda, para cortar las flores y llevarlas al mercado, en donde sus compradores son Hierberos que utilizan de estas flores para curaciones naturales. Considera que su actividad es muy rentable porque cada quincena percibe ganancias, además sus plantaciones le duran en promedio de 3 años, lo que no sucede con otros cultivos, como la papa o el maíz.  Para el futuro desea adquirir más terrenos y aumentar el número de reses y cuyes que tiene en su granja. Este es su octavo crédito con MFP, es muy responsable con sus pagos, además considera de mucha importancia este crédito, ya que le será muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. El crédito que solicita, lo utilizará en la compra de sacos de abono y semillas, para sembrar en otros  terrenos  más alfalfa y ruda, a fin de que su negocio perdure por mucho tiempo y que sus animales nunca le falte alimento.
texts.en:
Thirty-four-year-old Rocío is a single mother who lives with her two children in her own house. She has worked in agriculture and farming for 15 years. Her principal crops are alfalfa, which she feeds to her guinea pigs and cows, and rue, which is an aromatic herb native to her area. She inherited large tracts of land in her region from her parents; she generates income from this land. Every 15 days she visits her fields of rue to cut the flowers and take them to the market. Herbalists buy the flowers and use them as natural curatives. The sale of flowers is very profitable because she receives income every two weeks, and the plantings last 3 years on average, which is not the case with other crops such as potato or corn. In the future, she wants to acquire more land and increase the number of cattle and guinea pigs on her farm. This is her eighth loan from MFP (Microfinanzas Prisma, local lending institution). She is very responsible with her payments and considers this loan very important. It will be very useful in the growth of her business. This loan will be used to purchase bags of fertilizer and seeds and to sow more alfalfa and rue on other land, so that her business will last for a long time and her animals will never lack food.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bags of fertilizer and seeds of alfalfa and rue

loans.name: Mujeres De Esperanza 1,2 Group

texts.en:
Felicia is the coordinator of her group Mujeres de Esperanza (Women of Hope), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in Puerto Plata, an area on the north coast where the economy is based on tourism and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband.

Felicia is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling underwear and cleaning products to women in her neighborhood by purchasing more merchandise. She will use the profits to invest in repairing the roof of her home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase underwear and cleaning products

loans.name: Sophie

texts.fr: Madame Sophie M. est une femme mariée, mère de 8 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 10 et 21 ans. Elle habite dans la localité de Baye Laye et est membre de la caisse depuis octobre 2005. Elle a déjà bénéficié  de 2 prêts antérieurs. Lorsqu’elle a pris sa retraite elle s’est orientée vers le commerce de tissus saints, de balaies, de détergents  et de savons antiseptiques. Madame M. a choisi cette activité  car elle ne voulait pas rester oisive. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs pour renouveler son stock de tissus saints et de détergent. Ceci lui permettra de mieux rentabiliser son commerce et d’augmenter ses ressources.
texts.en:
Sophie M. is married and the mother of 8 children, ages 10 to 21 years old. She lives in Baye Laye and has been a member of the bank since October 2005. She has already received 2 previous loans. When she retired she started selling cleaning cloths, brooms, detergents and antiseptic soaps. Mrs. M. chose to start this business because she didn't want to be idle. She is asking for a loan of 100,000 frs to restock on cleaning cloths and detergent. This will enable her to make her business more profitable and increase her resources.

Translated from French by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cleaning supplies

loans.name: Ayichatou

texts.fr: Née en 1947 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, A. Ayichatou vit depuis 30 ans au quartier Gbèdagba à Sainte Rita (Cotonou). C'est une veuve ayant à sa charge trois enfants qui sont scolarisés. Ayichatou vit donc seule avec ses enfants. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Ayichatou vend des sachets et divers autres produits (savons, dentifrices, cigarettes, etc.) à son domicle. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Ayichatou s'approvisionne. Ayichatou est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà bénéficié de trois crédits, qui ont été tous bien remboursés. Ayichatou désire renforcer son activité et mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, afin de se faire également plus de revenu. Pour ce faire, Ayichatou sollicite un quatrième prêt de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born in 1947 in Cotonou, economic capital of Benin, Ayichatou A. has been living for 30 years in the neighborhood of Gbèdagba in Sainte Rita (Cotonou). She is a widow providing for three children who are in school. Thus Ayichatou lives alone with her children. To meet her needs, she sells, from her home, small plastic bags and various other products (soap, toothpaste, cigarettes, etc…). She gets her supplies in Dantokpa, international market of Benin. She is an old time customer of ALIDé having already received three loans, all fully reimbursed. Ayichatou wishes to strengthen her activity in order to better meet her customers’ demand, and also to make a better income. To do so Ayichatou is requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various products (small plastic bags, soap, toothpaste, cigarettes etc.)

loans.name: Mirella Marianela

texts.es:
El banco comunal Nueva Ciudad Alfaro se reúne en la bella tierra de Montecristi en la provincia de Manabí rodeada de los más bellos paisajes y playas de la región, este cantón se caracteriza por que en el habitan muchos artesanos dedicados a la fabricación de una variedad de artesanía en paja toquilla y tagua.

Una de las socias de este banco es la señora Mirella desde hace 3 ciclos viene trabajando con la fundación, ella es madre de de dos hijos, está casada desde hace 14 años, su ocupación es comerciante y lo hace de una manera informal, lleva ya 12 años dedicada a vender productos de belleza y ropa para damas, caballeros y niños la venta es por catálogo ella se encarga de ofrecerle a sus clientas y una vez realizado el pedido se encarga de entregarles en el domicilio.

Desde que esta con este negocio la señora Mirella no ha querido dejarlo, cuenta que es una manera de salir adelante ayudando al esposo en el hogar económicamente, se siente bien trabajando y la fundación Espoir le brinda la ayuda la oportunidad para que su negocio crezca cada día más, con este nuevo crédito nuestra socia podrá invertir en los productos de belleza como Avon, Yanbal y Esika y otra parte del crédito lo invertirá en ropa.

El sueño de nuestra socia es poder compararse un carro eso le facilitaría su negocio, y así podría extenderse a otros lugares para obtener mas clientes.
texts.en:
The “Nueva Ciudad Alfaro” (New City of Alfaro) communal bank meets in the beautiful Montecristi land, Manabí province, surrounded by the most beautiful scenery and beaches of the region. This canton is noted for the many resident artisans that manufacture a variety of crafts out of toquilla palm fronds (from which the mis-named ‘Panama’ hats are made) and tagua (tagua nut, sometimes known as ‘vegetable ivory’). One of the group members is Mirella who, for the last three loan cycles, has been collaborating with the foundation. She has been married for 14 years and has two children. She is an informal merchant and has sold beauty products and clothing for the entire family; her sales are catalogue based. She takes orders from her customers and then delivers the goods to their homes; she has been in this line of work for 12 years. Ever since Mirella started this business she hasn’t wanted to give it up; she tells us that it is a way for her to get ahead in life and help her husband meet household expenses. She is happy to work and Fundación Espoir provides the opportunity for her business to grow more each day. She will use this new funding in part to buy more Avon, Yanbal and Esika beauty products and partly to buy clothing. Her dream is to be able to buy a car to facilitate her work so that she can go to other areas to secure more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing and cosmetics.

loans.name: Marjorie Gabriela

texts.es:
Maryuri B. es muy joven, vive con su madre y  aun está soltera, pero reconoce ser una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable, está dedicada a dos negocios uno de ropa y otro de venta de productos de Esika, en ropa tiene ya 7 años, la ropa  la compra en Guayaquil en los distribuidores mayoristas, viaja dos veces al mes, y en Esika tiene solo cuatro meses,  con el dinero del crédito piensa invertir en el negocio, por su buena predisposición al trabajo los negocios le son muy rentables, y asegura que le dejan buenas ganancias, tiene los clientes fijos en Montecristi y en Manta, tiene 25 años, ella lleva tres ciclos en la fundación, agradece a la fundación porque en estos tres  ciclos tiene buenas ganancias, vende ropa de mujer, hombre y niño, vende a crédito, y dando facilidades para que en un mes  cancelen sus  clientes y recuperar el capital y vuelve a adquirir sus productos.

Con este nuevo crédito Maryuri viajara a comprar mas mercadería ya tiene varios pedidos por que se acerca la época de clase y mayo también son buenos meses para las ventas.

El sueño de Maryuri es tener su propio almacén de venta de ropa, por lo general la inversión que hace en el negocio es de 500 dólares y gana muy bien, también tiene un anhelo muy grande que es el de tener su propia casa, gracias a su trabajo y esfuerzo ya tiene el terreno, ahora falta construir la casa, asegura que con su dedicación al trabajo conseguirá hacer realidad su sueño, su  madre también es comerciante, en la venta de ropa, desde muy joven  quería empezar a trabajar , como tenía sus ahorros y eran 200 dólares, los invirtió  y gano el doble y así volvió a invertir ahora ve los frutos de su trabajo, también gracias al banco comunal, ahora está  trabajando más  duro para  hacer  crecer más su negocio.
texts.en:
Maryuri B. is very young; she lives with her mother and she’s still single. But, she is a hard-working, responsible woman. She is dedicated to two businesses: clothing sales and the sale of Esika beauty products. She has sold clothing for 7 years. She buys the clothes in Guayaquil from wholesalers twice a month. She has sold Esika for just 4 months. She intends to use the funds to invest in her businesses. Thanks to her good disposition toward work, her businesses are quite profitable and she assures us that they produce good profits. She has regular customers in Montecristi and in Manta. She is 25 years old and has been involved in three loan cycles with the foundation. She is grateful to the foundation because she has had good profits during these three cycles. She sells women, men and children clothing on one-month credit. At the end of the month, she collects from her customers, recovers her capital, and acquires products again. Maryuri will use these new funds to travel to buy more merchandise; she has several pending orders because the new school term is approaching and May is another good month for high sales volume. Maryuri’s dream is to have her own clothing store. In general, she invests 500 dollars in the business and does quite well. She also dreams with owning her own home. Thanks to her work and effort she already owns a lot; now she just has to build the house. She is sure that she will reach this goal with her hard work. Her mother is a clothing merchant too. Maryuri wanted to start working since she was very young. As she had some savings, 200 dollars, she invested them and doubled her investment. She then reinvested and now sees the fruits of her labors. Thanks, too, to the communal bank she is working even harder to make her business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
Manuela tiene 56 años de edad, es separada y vive junto a un hijo en el caserío Lagartera, una caserío de la zona rural del distrito de Mórrope, en la provincia de Lambayeque, situado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

La necesidad de salir adelante junto a su hijo hizo que hace diez años empezara a dedicarse a la crianza y venta de animales. Ella cría aves de corral, especialmente pavos que son las aves que más demanda tienen, para luego vendérselas a los negociantes que visitan la zona regularmente. Este negocio le provee de ingresos suficientes para solventar los gastos familiares, por ello da todo de si para sacarlo adelante.
