Ella desea mejorar la calidad de las aves que cría para así aumentar sus ventas y sus ganancias, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de alimento balanceado.

Manuela es una mujer luchadora y que gusta mucho de las actividades que realiza, sus vecinos y conocidos la consideran una mujer de confianza. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado ser una cliente puntual y responsable al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Manuela, 56, is separated and lives with her son in the Lagartera settlement, a rural area of Mórrope, Lambayeque province, which is an hour away from the city of Chiclayo. Her need to survive with her son led her to start raising animals for sale ten years ago. She raises barnyard fowl, especially turkeys, which are the most sought-after fowl. She sells them to merchants that come to her area regularly. This business provides her with income sufficient to meet family expenses. For this reason, she gives all of herself to insure that it is successful. She wants to improve the quality of her turkeys so that her sales and profits will improve. She is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan, therefore, to buy nutritionally balanced feed. Manuela is a tenacious woman who enjoys her work very much. Her neighbors and acquaintances consider her to be a trustworthy woman. She has collaborated with our institution in the past and has shown herself to be a punctual and responsible person with respect to repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy nutritionally-balanced barnyard fowl feed.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Miguel Ángel tiene 52 años, su actividad económica es brindar el servicio de carpintería. Inicio con un hermano trabajando como albañil,  el era un hombre muy emprendedor y luchador que se le presentaban muchos trabajos, de aquí aprendió muchas cosas y así fue que él aprendió su otro oficio como es la carpintería el decidió buscar el capital necesario. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de materia prima como madera, pinturas y otras herramientas. El sueño de Miguel es mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Miguel Ángel is 52 years old. His business is offering carpentry services. He began working with a brother as a bricklayer. He was a very enterprising and hardworking man, and so he was given a lot of work. From there learned a lot of skills, and that is how he learned his other trade, carpentry. He decided to look for needed capital. The financing that he is requesting is to purchase raw materials, such as wood, paints and other tools. Miguel's dream is to improve the conditions of his housing.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Yamileth Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Yamileth Del Carmen se dedica al negocio de venta de ropa usada, la cual vende en su casa y también de forma ambulante. Ella actualmente es casada, tiene 50 años y tiene 3 hijos, todos mayores de edad. Ella inicio con este negocio desde hace seis años, lo que ella hacía en ese tiempo era comprar  en Managua y salir a vender, ya que los precios de los artículos de vestuario son más caros. Ya que sus ventas son en su mayoría al crédito, a recuperarse en 15 días, lo mas 30 días. Actualmente está solicitando este crédito con el propósito de invertirlo en la compra de 2 pacas de ropa usada, ya que desea diversificar el producto que actualmente esta ofreciéndole a sus clientes. Ella sueño es establecer una tienda grande en el mercado de Managua en que pueda vender ropa al por mayor, esto con el propósito de dejarles algún día a sus hijos un negocio bien establecido.
texts.en:
Doña Yamileth Del Carmen is dedicated to the business of selling used clothing, which she sells from home and also door-to-door. She is currently married, 50 years old and has three sons, all of them grown up. She started this business six years ago; what she did then was to buy clothes in Managua and go out to sell, since the prices of the articles of clothing are more expensive. Most of her sales are on credit, and are collected in 15 days, or 30 days at the latest. Currently she is requesting this credit to invest in the purchase of two bundles of used clothing, since she wishes to diversify the products she is currently offering her customers. Her dream is to establish a large store in the Managua market where she can sell clothing in bulk, this with the purpose of leaving her sons with a well established business.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Assa

texts.en:
Assa D. est une femme de 52 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de Thieckène depuis 5ans et a une bonne expérience avec le crédit pour en avoir bénéficier 10 fois de suite. Elle est propriétaire d'une boutique où elle vend de l'huile, du riz, du sucre etc.. son activité lui procure de bénéfices qui lui permettent de participer à la prise en charge familiale.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her shop with products

loans.name: Juana Adilia

texts.es: Doña Juana, es una mujer muy trabajadora y activa, desde hace varios años administra su propio negocio, que inicio con fondos propios y ayuda de su familia,. Con los financiamientos que ha tenido ha logrado hacer las mejoras a su casa. Para dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, lo cual ha ido haciendo. Con algunas dificultades que las ventas se ponen bajas, pero siempre se vende. Esta temporada de verano es buena el cual viajara a puerto cabezas al norte del país donde establecerá la fritanga es por eso con esta inversión hará compra de granos básicos, carne, pollo, frutas, verduras, gaseosas, golosinas para vender en variedad y a preferencia del cliente. El cual espera lograr el objetivo de mejorar las ventas como obtener mejores ganancias. Sus planes es poder  poner cerámica, comprar mesa, para una mejor comodidad en su negocio, y poder atraer clientes nuevos.
texts.en:
Miss Juana is a very hardworking and active woman. For several years she has administered her own business, which she started with her own funds and with the help of her family. With the financing she has obtained she has managed to make improvements to her home to provide her customers with better service, which she been able to do. It has been difficult sometimes when sales are low, but there are always sales. This summer season is good to travel to Puerto Cabezas in the northern part of the country, where she will set up a place to sell food. This is why with this investment she will buy basic grains, meat, chicken, fruits, vegetables, sodas, and candy to sell what her customers prefer. She hopes to increase her sales and obtain higher profits. Her plans are to install ceramic tiles and to buy a table for the comfort of her customers, and to attract new clients.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic grains, meat, chicken, fruits, vegetables, sodas, and candy

loans.name: Marilu

texts.es: Marilú, D. 46 años, vive con su esposo  y su menor hijo en una casa alquilada.DesD. hace 12 años, se dedica a L. venta D. productos D. belleza, en un inicio salía a vender recorriendo las calles D. su barrio .En L. actualidad ya tiene clientes que siempre  le piden, y paralelamente se dedica a ofrecer el  servicio D. peinados y corte D. cabello, a domicilio, mientras peina no pierD. oportunidad y aprovecha para ofrecer sus productos D. belleza al crédito. Ambos  trabajos le han traído mucha satisfacción  porque le permiten ser independiente en sus ingresos y  tiene L. libertad D. ofrecer  promociones cuando tiene mayor  cantidad D. productos para vender. Para el futuro tiene planeado instalar un salón D. belleza en un local estable, ya que actualmente ofrece el servicio D. peinados y corte D. cabello en las casas D. sus clientes .Es L. primera vez que tiene un crédito y promete será  muy responsable con sus pagos y agradece  a todas las  personas que hicieron posible el  préstamo que  le será  muy útil en el progreso D. sus negocios.Marilú tiene pensado invertir el dinero solicitado  en L. compra D.  cosméticos  al por mayor y también comprará tintes y líquidos para seguir brindando el servicio D. peinados  a domicilio.
texts.en:
Marilú is 46 years old. She lives with her husband and her youngest son in a rented house. She has worked selling beauty products for the past 12 years. Initially she sold door-to-door in her neighborhood. Currently she has customers that always order from her and in parallel she works offering a home hairdresser service. While she is doing the hair, she never misses an opportunity to offer her beauty products on credit. Both jobs have been very satisfying to her because they allow her to be independent with her income and she is free to offer sales when she has a large amount of products to sell. In the future she plans on setting up a beauty salon at a specific location. She currently offers her hairdressing service in her customers’ homes. This is the first time she has had a loan. Se promises that she will be responsible with the payments and she thanks all the people that maD. this loan possible. It will be very helpful for the progress of her businesses. Marilú has thought of investing the money she applied for in buying cosmetics at wholesale. She will also buy dyes and liquids in order to continue offering her hairdresser service in her customer’s homes.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty products for her businesses

loans.name: Saul

texts.es: Saúl tiene 43 años, es divorciado y vive solo en casa alquilada. Desde hace 15 años que trabaja de manera independiente, tiene su propia banda musical, en donde tiene presentaciones en eventos sociales como: fiestas de graduación, matrimonios, bautizos, cumpleaños y todo tipo de eventos. Por lo que lleva mucha experiencia en este trabajo de producción  musical. Él es el representante de su banda, además toca la batería electrónica, por lo que disfruta mucho de este trabajo, en compañía de sus demás compañeros. Este negocio de presentaciones musicales, le es rentable para  Saúl, porque hay gran demanda de su trabajo y frecuentemente siempre hay eventos que se realiza en su ciudad. Su deseo es  mejorar su banda con instrumentos nuevos, además de extender la fama de su banda por toda la región. Este es su noveno crédito con MFP, por  lo que ha demostrado en este tiempo, ser muy responsable con el pago de sus cuotas. Además considera que éste crédito es importante para el desarrollo de su trabajo. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en los gastos de las presentaciones que tiene, como: transporte y el alquiler de equipos de sonido.
texts.en:
Saul is 43 years old and divorced, and lives alone in a house that he rents. For 15 years he has worked independently, and he has his own music band, where he has performed in social gatherings such as graduation parties, weddings, baptisms, birthdays, and all types of events. He has a lot of experience in the music business. He is the representative member of his band, and he also plays the electric drums. This is why he enjoys his work, in the company of the other members of the band. This business of music performances is profitable to Saul since there is great demand for his work and frequently there are events that are done in his city. His wish is to improve his band with new instruments, and to extend the fame of his band throughout the region. This is his ninth loan with MFP, and he has been very responsible in his payments throughout this time. Furthermore, he considers that this credit is important for the progress of his work. The proceeds of this loan will be invested in expenses related to his performances such as transportation and the rental of sound equipment.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: expenses related to his performances such as transportation and the rental of sound equipment

loans.name: Rosalvina Jacinta

texts.es: La Sra. Rosalvina tiene 39 años de edad, es madre soltera   de un hijo de 9 años, ella vive en casa alquilada ubicada en Santa Rosa de Lima del distrito de Parcona. Ella se dedica a la venta de pollo por mayor y menor en el mercado Niño jesus de Ayavi en puento alquilado. Ella se dedica a este negocio hace 7 años, se incio como ayudante del mismo rubro. L a Sra. Rosalvina tiene muchos sueños y objetivos, uno de ellos es poder terner su casa propia. Con el dinero que solicita invertira en la compra de una congeladora y algunos gastos escolares.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosalvina is 39 years old and a single mother of a nine year old son. She lives in a rented house located in Santa Rosa de Lima in the District of Parcona. She sells chicken wholesale and retail from a rented stall at the Niño Jesus de Ayavi Market. Rosalvina has been in this business for seven years and started out working as an assistant. She has many dreams and goals, one of them being having her own house. With the money she requested, Rosalvina will invest in the purchase of a freezer and pay for a few school expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a freezer & pay for her child's school expenses

loans.name: Macaria

texts.es:
Macaria pertenece al banco comunal “Reyna D. los Ángeles”, ella es una D. las fundadoras del banco comunal. 

Macaria, tiene 69 años, tiene siete hijos. Ella es una madre responsable que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus menores hijos. 

Macaria se dedica a la venta D. chicha D. jora (La chicha D. jora es una bebida ancestral en el Perú y América, y su principal ingrediente es la jora o maíz fermentado.). Macaria en su domicilio acomodo una habitación y la convirtió en una picantería (Lugar donD. se venD. la chicha D. jora que se caracteriza por tener una bandera D. color rojo amarrado con una flor que se cuelga en la puerta principal del local). Ella solo los días miércoles venD. la chicha D. jora.

Macaria también se dedica a la venta D. verduras por mayor, ella distribuye sus productos a las vendedoras D. la feria D.  mercado D. Huancaro. Ella también envía verduras para vender en la ciudad D. puerto Maldonado. La socia nos cuenta que tiene una chacra en Puerto Maldonado donD. produce castaña, Su esposo le envía castaña para que ella venda en la ciudad del Cusco,  Ya son 20 años que se dedica a la venta D. verduras y le ha ido muy bien. 

Macaria requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas D. verduras y castaña. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Macaria belongs to the Communal Bank “Reyna D. los Ángeles” (Queen of the Angels) and is also one of the founding members. She is 69 years old and has seven children. Macaria is a responsible mother who looks at each moment as an opportunity to succeed. Each day she strives to proviD. a better future for her younger children.

Macaria sells “chicha D. jora” (an ancestral beverage of Peru and the Americas that is maD. from fermented corn). She set asiD. a room in her house and converted it into a “picantería” (a place that sells “chica D. jora” and is identified by a red flag tied to a flower that hangs on the front door of the building). Macaria sells this product only on Wednesdays.

In addition, Macaria sells vegetables in bulk. She distributes her products to the vendors at the market fair in Huancaro. Macaria also ships vegetables to be sold in the city of Puerto Maldonado. She says she has a farm in Puerto Maldonado that produces chestnuts. Her husband ships the chestnuts to be sold in the city of Cusco. She has 20 years of experience selling vegetables and has done very well.

Macaria needs a loan to purchase vegetable seeds and chestnuts. She is grateful for this opportunity and commits to making her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase vegetable seeds & chestnuts

loans.name: 29 De Setiembre Group

texts.es:
El comité 29 de Setiembre , pertenecen al barrio Central de Limpio. Este comite se encuentra trabajando unidas con muchos deseos de progreso.
Ellas  se reunen semanalmente para informarse de la situación de cada integrante para cuelquer casa de necesidad para así ayudar. Todas se encuentran muy conformes con las actividades que realizan y se sienten muy comprometidas con el comite. 
La Sra. Rosalia es una de las integrantes y se dedica a actividades de despensa (Venta de productos de uso domestico), al mismo tiempo da oportunidades de trabajo a personas dedicadas a ventas ambulantes de aceites, azucar, carnicos entre otros.
Tiene interés en aumentar el stock de su negocio, de modo a incrementar sus ingresos satisfaciendo la demanda mediante la mayor distribución de sus mercaderías.
Ha solicitado el préstamos para la compra de mercaderias como; azucar, fideos, arroz, aceites, yerba y otros.
texts.en:
The committee “29 de Setiembre” (September 29th) is part of the central neighborhood of Limpio. This committee works together with great hopes of making progress. They meet on a weekly basis to learn about the situation of each member and determine who is in need of help. The members are satisfied with their activities and are very committed to the committee.

Sra. Rosalia is a committee member who manages a food pantry (where she sells products for household use). At the same time, she provides employment opportunities for traveling merchants who sell oil, sugar, meat, and other products. She is interested in expanding her business inventory so that she can satisfy demand through greater distribution of her products. Rosalia is requesting a loan to buy merchandise such as sugar, noodles, rice, oil, herbs, and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sugar, noodles, rice, oil, herbs, and other items

loans.name: Lauréat

texts.fr: A. Lauréat est née le 18 Juillet 1980 et est mariée à GBETOFIA Rigobert. Le couple a un enfant qui n'est pas encore scolarisé. La famille vit à Agla à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, depuis cinq ans. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la famille. Lauréat a appris la coiffure et l'exerce depuis trois ans. Parallèlement à cette activité, Lauréat vend des mèches et des produits cosmétiques dans son atelier situé à Agla. Lauréat s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Lauréat a bénéficié antérieurement de deux crédits qu'elle avait bien remboursés. La clientèle de Lauréat s'accroît de plus en plus et Lauréat voudrait élever davantage le niveau de son activité, afin de mieux répondre aux différents besoins de ses clients. C'est la raison pour laquelle Lauréat sollicite un troisième prêt de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Lauréat A. was born on July 18, 1980 and is married to Rigobert Gbetofia. The couple has one child that is not yet in school. The family has lived in Agla, Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin for five years. Together, the couple takes care of the different family expenses. Lauréat learned hairdressing and has done it for three years. Parallel to this, she sells hair extensions and cosmetics in her studio in Agla. Lauréat stocks up in Dantokpa, Bénin's international market. Lauréat has received two loans that she has repaid. Her customers have increased more and more and Lauréat would like to raise the level of her work, in order to better respond to the different needs of her customers. This is why she requests a third loan from Alidé.

Translated from French by Flavia Garcia, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of hair extensions and different cosmetics

loans.name: Codou

texts.fr: Codou D. est âgée de 41 ans, elle est veuve et vit avec ses 3 enfants dont elle a l'entière charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de THIECKENE depuis 8ans et demi. Elle est très expérimentée en matière de crédit et dans son domaine d'activité. Elle est vendeuse de fruits; elle achète son produit à bord champ, dans les vergers, et revend au niveau du marché de son quartier et ses bénéfices lui permettent de prend sa progéniture en charge et de subvenir à ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
Codou D. is 41 years old. She is a widow and lives with her three children for whom she is the sole support. She has been a member of the Thieckene “Banc Villageois” loan group for 8 ½ years, and is quite experienced with regard to credit loans and her area of activity. She is a fruit vendor; she buys her produce in fields and orchards for resale in local markets. Her profits enable her to take care of her offspring and meet her own personal needs.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Develop her activity as fruit vendor

loans.name: Mariama Cire

texts.fr: Madame Mariama  Cire D. est mariée  et mère  de 3 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 3 et 16 ans. Elle est âgée de 27 ans et habite dans la localité  de Baye Laye. Elle évolue  dans le commerce de produits cosmétiques  depuis 4 ans. Auparavant elle a beaucoup voyage vers le Mali, la Mauritanie et aussi vers la Gambie pour acheter des tissus et autres articles destines a la vente. C’est une activité qu’elle a hérité  de sa grand-mère  et de sa mère qui vivait à Dakar et y pratiquait l’activité  de commerce. Mais plutôt c’est sa grand-mère  qui  lui confiait ses marchandises pour qu’elle  les vende lorsqu’elle vivait  avec elle  a Tambacounda jusqu'à ce qu’elle  eut  l’amour du commerce. Elle sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs pour renforcer sa boutique en produits cosmétiques  car c’est la période de froid qui est plus favorable a son commerce. L’augmentation de ses profits lui permettra de satisfaire ses besoins quotidiens.
texts.en:
Mariama Cire D. is married and mother to three children between the ages of 3 and 16. She is 27 years old and lives in Baye Laye. For four years, she has grown in the cosmetics business. She has traveled a lot in Mali, Mauritania and also around the Gambia to purchase fabrics and other goods for sale. It is an activity that she inherited from her grandmother and mother who lived in Dakar and who practiced the business. More so, it was her grandmother that entrusted her with merchandise to sell around Tambacounda where Mariama lived, until she found love for the business. She requests a loan of 200,000 FRS to build up her cosmetic products, but its the cold period that is best for business. The increase of her profits will allow her satisfy her daily needs.

Translated from French by Flavia Garcia, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen funds for cosmetics business

loans.name: Pabla

texts.es:
La señora Pabla Baéz tiene 54 años D. edad, esta casada, tiene 3 hijas, todas mayores D. edad e independientes.
La señora Pabla tiene una farmacia hace 18 años D. antigüedad en su domicilio, inicio esta actividad luego D. recibirse hace varios años atrás, por que después del matrimonio nacieron sus hijos y decidió criarlos primeramente hasta cierta edad, luego con el apoyo D. su esposo habilitó su farmacia que hasta la fecha mantiene una buena clientela.
Solicita el crédito para compra D. medicamentos en promoción por temporada.
texts.en:
54-year old Señora Pabla Baéz is married and has three daughters, all of them adults and independent. Pabla has run a pharmacy for the last 18 years out of her home. She started the business a few years ago after qualifying as a pharmacist, but first she raised her children after getting married. Then with her husband's support she set up her pharmacy which to this day has a loyal clientele. Pabla needs a loan to buy medical products on sale at this time of the year.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy medical products on sale

loans.name: Santos Luis

texts.es: El Sr. Santos tiene 39 años de edad,  es casado tiene una hija de 16 años de edad, su conyugue es ama de casa. Ellos cuentan con casa propia de material noble  de dos pisos recien construida,  ubicado en el Distrito de la Tinguiña, el es maestro de construccion y tambien cuenta con 3 motos taxis el cual recien a adquirido las dos ultimas. El se dedica como maestro de cosntruccion hace 10 años . El cuenta con su maquinaria propia como maderas y otros. El tiene muchos sueños y objetivos uno de ellos es poder tener mas vehiculos para tener mayor ingreso. Con el dinero que solicita invertira en el  mantenimiento de sus vehiculos.
texts.en:
Sr. Santos is 39 years old, married, and has a 16 year old daughter. His wife is a homemaker. Their house was recently constructed and is made of solid materials and has two stories. Santos and his family live in the District of La Tinguiña. He is a master builder and also has three motorcycle taxis, having recently acquired two of them. Santos has been a master builder for ten years. He has his own machinery for working with wood and other materials.

Santos has many dreams and goals, one of them being having more vehicles to generate additional income. The loan he requested will be used to invest in the maintenance of his vehicles.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Maria Natividad

texts.es:
Las reuniones del Banco Comunal San Andrés las vienen realizando en la parroquia Picoaza a 10 minutos de la capital manabita, la María Natividad Gloria pertenece a este Banco como socia fundadora.

María es soltera de 42 años se dedica a la guardería en la misma parroquia donde vive, ella es la encargada de preparar los alimentos para los niños de la guardería, pero nuestra socia es una mujer que le gusta trabajar y por ello tiene una tienda en su casa donde vende colas, cervezas, galletas golosinas a encargada de atender la tienda es la mamá, mientras la señora María Natividad en la guardería trabaja desde las 8 am hasta las 4pm una vez que sale de ahí se dedica a vender Avon con este negocio inicio hace 10 años y con la tienda 1 año.

Con este nuevo préstamo que va a recibir nuestra socia, invertirá en productos de Avon y en cervezas que es lo que más se vende.

El  mayor anhelo de la señora María Natividad es seguir con su negocio.
texts.en:
The meetings of the San Andrés Communal Bank are held in Picoaza Parish, which is ten minutes away from the capital of Manabita. María Natividad is one of the founding members of this Communal Bank.

She is 42 years old, single, and manages a nursery school in the same parish where she lives. María is in charge of preparing the meals for the children. She is also a woman who enjoys working, so she set up a store in her home where she sells soft drinks, beer, cookies, and candy. Her mother looks after the store while she works at the nursery school from 8am until 4pm. In addition, Maria sells Avon products, which she started ten years ago after she opened her store the previous year.

With this new loan, she will invest in Avon cosmetics and beer, the product that sells the most. Her greatest wish is to continue with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Avon products and beer

loans.name: Marie Pierre

texts.fr: Marie Pierre N. est âgée de 51 ans, elle est mariée et mère d'un enfant en charge. Elle est membre du Banc villageois de THIECKENE depuis de 9 ans et y a reçu 18 prêts qu'elle a toujours bien gérés et remboursés à temps. Elle est vendeuse de fruits au marché de la gare routière de son quartier. Avec ses bénéfices elle soutien son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
Marie Pierre N. is 51 years old. She is married and the mother of one child. She has been a member of the Thieckene Villagers Bank for the last 9 years, and has received 18 loans which she has always well managed and repaid on time. She sells fruit at her neighborhood bus-stop market. With her earnings she would support her husband in handling the family's needs.

Translated from French by Colleen Creegan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To grow and strengthen her income generating activities

loans.name: Maria Nicolasa

texts.es: Doña María Vásquez cuenta con 43 años de edad, es casada de oficios Artesana, “Elaboración de Cortes Típicos” cuenta con un taller, habita junto a sus 2 hijos conjuntamente con su esposo, Ella y su esposo se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 8 años de laborar Cortes Tipicos  en su residencia que se encuentra en el Caserío la Centro, de la Aldea Vásquez, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que ella pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a sus hijos, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Doña María Vásquez is 43 years old, married, and works as a craftswoman who makes traditional skirts in her workshop. She lives with her husband and two children. Doña María and her husband manage their business with the help of two employees who do the same work. She has been producing traditional skirts for eight years from her home, which is located in Caserío la Centro in the village of Vásquez, Department of Totonicapán, Guatemala. The demand from her customers is currently growing, but her financial condition is not sufficient to generate additional capital. For this reason, she has come to Asociación ASDIR to request a loan with the intention of buying raw materials so that she can increase her sales. Doña María also hopes to succeed for her family and provide them better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials for making traditional skirts

loans.name: Elva

texts.es:
Elva es una persona puntual y responsable con sus obligaciones eso lo demuestra su historial crediticio.
Ella se dedica a la confección artesanal y venta de prendas de punto como son: chompas, guantes, tapetes, y otros prendas que sus clientes solicitan. Elva lleva sus productos a vender a diferentes provincias del Perú, para así obtener mayores ganancias, Además tiene la oportunidad de conocer diferentes lugares. Con las ganancias obtenidas y con mucho esfuerzo logro construir habitaciones en su casa y  ayudar a su hijo en sus estudios. Ella desea exportar sus tejidos a otros países así que necesita invertir para mejorar su producción. Elva agradece a todos las personas que hacen posible su préstamo.
texts.en:
Elva is a person who is punctual and responsible with her obligations, as demonstrated by her credit history. She makes and sells hand-knitted items such as sweaters, mittens, tablecloths, and other products that her customers request. She brings her products she has for sale to different provinces throughout Peru in order to generate the highest earnings. This also gives her the opportunity to become familiar with different places. With the money she earned and with great effort, she added rooms to her house and helped her son with his studies. Elva hopes to export her hand-knitted items to other countries, so she needs to improve her production. She thanks everyone who made this loan possible.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products for her business

loans.name: Betsy Alexandra

texts.es:
En la parroquia Picoaza a pocos minutos de la capital manabita vistamos en banco comunal San Andrés, este en un sitio donde sus habitantes se dedican al comercio en diferentes formas, ya sea la venta de ropa, utensilio de cocina y en época de navidad es en este lugar donde se pueden encontrara los juguetes mas económicos y de todos los modelos.

La Señora Alexandra tiene 28 años con 3 hijos y desde hace 2 ciclos esta formando parte  de este banco comunal, con su actual esposo ella han formado una pequeña dulcería, su especialidad son las cocadas, la mamá de el esposo fue quien les motivo para que tenga su negocio, la señora Alexandra se encarga de la preparación de los dulces mientras que el esposo es el encargado de llevar a cabo la venta.

Para nuestra socia Alexandra el hecho de tener este negocio desde hace 6 años le ha permitido ir creciendo en ámbito personal y profesional. Ahora ella ya tiene su negocio bien establecido y por ahora piensa seguir con el mismo se siente muy a gusto trabajando en el, con este nuevo préstamo es para invertir en la materia prima que es el coco, azúcar y fundas, ahora ya tiene mas clientes y sus cocadas se venden en otras provincias.
texts.en:
In the parish of Picoaza, which is a few minutes away from the capital of Manabita, we visited the San Andrés Communal Bank. The inhabitants of this area are involved in different forms of trade such as selling clothing and cooking utensils. During the Christmas season, this is the place to find the most affordable toys of all types.

Sra. Alexandra is 28 years old and has three children. She has been part of this Communal Bank for the last two loan cycles. Alexandra and her husband opened a small candy store, with her specialty being coconut macaroons. Her mother-in-law was the person who convinced them to start this business. Alexandra is in charge of preparing the sweets while her husband is responsible for conducting the sales.

She has owned her business for six years and says that it has helped her to grow personally and professionally. Now that her business is well-established, she plans to continue working in the same manner because she enjoys the experience. With this new loan she will invest in raw materials such as coconut, sugar, and bags. Now that she has more customers, her coconut macaroons are selling in other provinces.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase coconut, sugar, and bags

loans.name: Jose Eulalio

texts.es: Don José Gutiérrez cuenta con 37 años de edad, es casado de oficios Comerciante, “Compra y venta de gorras y sombreros” cuenta con un pequeño negocio, lleva 10 años de vender gorras y sombreros  en su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje Choescuela, Cantón Juchanep, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar más mercadería y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tener mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Don José Gutiérrez is 37 years old, married, and works as a merchant. He has been buying and selling caps and hats for ten years. His home is in Paraje Choescuela, Juchanep Canton, Department of Totonicapán in Guatemala. The demand from his customers is currently growing, but his financial condition is not sufficient and he is in need of additional capital. For this reason, he has come to Asociación ASDIR to request a loan with the intention of buying more merchandise to increase his sales. He also hopes to succeed for his family and provide them better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to buy caps & hats

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es: Martha Lorena tiene la edad de 30 años por lo que tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación, ella tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. Su actividad económica es una pulpería es una persona muy humilde, pues siempre busca la forma de salir adelante, ella ha obtenido mucha experiencia con este negocio. Es así que decide que con su pequeña pulpería sobrevivir. Con este financiamiento comprara productos como refrescos, pan, detergentes y pollo. Desea tener una casa más grande para que su negocio se convierta en una distribuidora.
texts.en:
Martha Lorena is 30 years old and has been working with the Foundation for a long time. She has two dependent children. Martha is a humble person who manages a grocery store and is always looking for ways to get ahead. This business has allowed her to gain much experience. She decided to start this business because she needed a means to survive.

With this loan Martha will buy products such as soft drinks, bread, detergents, and chicken. She desires to have a larger house because she wants to convert her business into a distribution center.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to buy more merchandise

loans.name: Flor Del Pilar

texts.es: Flor tiene 24 años y vive en la casa de sus padres, con su madre y hermanos. Desde su niñez se ha dedicado a la agricultura, sembrando papa, maíz, quinua, arveja, cebolla y zanahoria, de acuerdo a la temporada climática de cada producto, es así que siempre esta en constante actividad, aplicando abono a sus terrenos de cultivo, que le fueron heredados. Sus hermanos la ayudan en esta labor y las veces que no pueden, contrata peones para que realicen el trabajo de siembra y cosecha. Es así, con el pasar del tiempo, cosecha maíz  y demás productos, exceptuando la papa, debido a que le son más rentables. Para Flor le es importante continuar cultivando en sus tierras y buscar otras estrategias de venta que le generen más ganancias. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP, por lo que se ha comprometido nuevamente en ser muy responsable con el pago de sus cuotas, considerando éste crédito muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de abono y semillas para sembrar zanahoria.
texts.en:
Flor is 24 years old and lives in her parents’ house with her mother and siblings. Since childhood she has been engaged in farming – growing potatoes, corn, quinoa, peas, onions, and carrots based on the seasonal climate for each product. Determining these factors is a constant activity. Flor also is in charge of applying compost to the farmland that she inherited. Her siblings help with the labor, but during the times when they are not able, she hires workers to perform the tasks of planting and harvesting. With the passage of time, she began growing corn and other products that are the most profitable. Flor believes it is important to continue cultivating her land and looking for her sales strategies to generate more income.

This is her sixth loan with MFP. She is recommitted to being responsible with her payments since she considers the loans to be useful in helping progress her business. With the loan she requested, Flor will invest in the purchase of compost and seeds for planting carrots.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost and seeds for planting carrots

loans.name: Dora

texts.en:
Our client Dora is part of the Los Diamantes communal bank. This bank, whose name means “The Diamonds” in English, consists of 32 members all hailing from the Cuzco area. Dora is a 44-year-old mother of three and she lives with her children and spouse in the city of Cuzco. 

To make a living, Dora engages in a number of activities. For one, she offers cell phone use for a fee to passersby on the street, somewhat like a modern-day walking payphone. As the Peruvian school year started up in March, Dora also sold school supplies for a few weeks this year. Her real dream, though, is to sell artisan goods. Dora plans to use the loan she receives from Kiva to start up her own business making and selling artisan goods. Specifically, she hopes to buy a machine to help her weave. 

Dora is appreciative and thankful for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To buy a machine to help her weave

loans.name: Angelica Patricia

texts.es:
En la parroquia Picoaza a pocos minutos de la capital manabita vistamos en banco comunal San Andrés, este en un sitio donde sus habitantes se dedican al comercio en diferentes formas, ya sea la venta de ropa, utensilio de cocina y en época de navidad es en este lugar donde se pueden encontrar a los juguetes más económicos y de todos los modelos. 

La señora Angélica de 26 es casada hace nueve años es madre de dos niños ella es un exelente ama de casa pero a la vez le dedica tiempo  a  su negocio que es una mini tienda que la  tiene en su propia casa, ella vive en la un sector donde no hay tienda y le va muy bien desde que la tiene, nos comentó que ahora con la situación económica que esta difícil ella   se ayuda mucho con los créditos que la fundación le entrega, eso le ha permitido mantener su tienda, a pesar de que su esposo le ayuda en la casa con lo poco que gana en los trabajos que le salen de albañil.

La señora Angélica ha pensado crecer en las ventas en esta ocasión podrá invertir el dinero en la mini tienda y también va a dedicarse a vender ropa para damas caballeros y niños, como pantalones, ropa interior, entre otros, está segura que le ira muy bien, porque ella no descarta hacer realidad el sueño de su vida tener su propia casa.
texts.en:
In the Picoaza parish, a few minutes from the capital, we visit the communal bank San Andrés. This is a place where the residents make their livings in different types of commerce, be it selling clothing or kitchen utensils. At Christmas season, this is the place to find the best prices on every model of toys. Señora Angélica, who is 26 years old, has been married for nine years, is the mother of two children, and is an excellent housewife. In addition, she dedicates time to her business, which is a mini market located in her house. She lives in the area not occupied by the store, and things have been going very well since she opened the store. She told us that now, with the economic situation, it's been difficult. She has been helped a great deal with the loans that the foundation has given her; they have allowed her to keep up her store in spite of the fact that her husband earns very little in his work as a bricklayer and helps her at home. Señora Angélica is thinking of growing her sales; this time she plans to invest the money in the mini market and also in selling women's, men's and children's clothing, such as pants and undergarments, among others. She is certain that it will go well because she has not given up on realizing her dream of owning her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase woemen's, men's and children's clothing

loans.name: Julia Victoria

texts.es:
El negocio de cerámica es lo que ayuda a Julia a salir adelante, hace trabajos para distribuidoras de alimentos balanceados para animales como: bebederos y comederos de cuyes, conejos etc. además tazas y platos artesanales. Con el tiempo Julia a podido mejorar la calidad de sus productos, es por eso que tiene algunos clientes que hacen  pedidos mensualmente. 
Con las ganancias puede aportar para los gastos familiares ya que tiene 4 hijos que mantener.
El préstamo obtenido lo invertirá en comprar productos como son arcilla, loza y otros productos que necesita para hacer un mejor trabajo y aminorar sus costos.
Julia tiene como objetivo comprar un terreno el cual será destinado para taller de cerámica, además le gustaría enseñar y dar trabajo a otras personas que lo necesiten.
texts.en:
The pottery business is what has helped Julia to get ahead. She fabricates works for animal feed distribution companies like: drinking and feeding troughs for guinea pigs, rabbits etc. She also makes handcrafted cups and plates. With time, Julia has been able to improve the quality of her products, and because of that she has clients who place monthly orders. With her profits, she is able to contribute toward the family expenses, and she has 4 children to take care of. She will invest the loan she receives in the purchase of products like clay, china and other items that she needs to produce a better product and reduce her costs. Julia has as an objective purchasing a plot of land which would be used as a pottery workshop. In addition, she would like to teach and employ those in need.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products

loans.name: Gloria Maribel

texts.es:
Las reuniones del Banco Comunal San Andrés las vienen realizando en la parroquia Picoaza a unos 10 minutos de la capital manabita, la señora Gloria pertenece a este Banco desde hace 8 ciclos.

La señora Gloria de 39 años es madre soltera de dos hijos se dedica hacer una excelente ama  de casa, pero por motivos que tiene que dedicarse a los hijos y no puede trabajar sola, ella decidió entrar a trabajar en sociedad con su hermano, el dinero que recibe de la fundación lo invierte en la venta informal de productos como carteras, delantal, mandil, con este crédito invertirá todo en el negocio, el  hermano de la señora Gloria sale a vender recorriendo de ciudad en ciudad en la misma provincia donde viven ya tiene sus clientes fijos en ciudades como Chone, Calceta, y  Junín.

Para abastecerse tienen que viajar hasta  Quito donde hacen las compras en los grandes distribuidores, el hermano de la señora Gloria compra según lo que mas vende, una vez que haya vendido y saca el capital le devuelve a la señora gloria, el sueño de nuestra socia es poder tener un negocio mas completo como un almacén y ella misma atenderlo sin tener que salir.
texts.en:
The meetings of the communal bank San Andrés are conducted in Picoaza parish, about 10 minutes from the capital, Manabita. Señora Gloria has belonged to this bank for 8 cycles. Señora Gloria is 39 years old, is a single mother of two children and spends her time taking excellent care of her household. But because she has to take care of her children and can't work alone, she decided to enter into a business partnership with her brother. She will invest the money that she receives from the corporation in the informal sale of products like wallets, kitchen aprons and leather aprons. The entire loan will be invested in the business. Señora Gloria's brother makes their sales by going from city to city in the province where they live. He already has steady customers in cities like Chone, Calceta and Junín. To stock up, they have to travel all the way to Quito, where they make their purchases from the large distributors. Señora Gloria's brother makes their purchases according to what sells well, and once everything has sold, he figures the capital and returns it to Señora Gloria. Our member's dream is to have a more complete business, like a shop that she can work in herself and not have to go out.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase clothing, kitchen aprons, wallets and leather aprons.

loans.name: Betty

texts.es: Betty, de 43 años, vive con su pequeño  hijo en casa de un familiar.Desde hace 10 años, se dedica  a la compra y venta de animales, sus  hermanos le ayudan a verificar que los animales que adquiere  se encuentren  en buen estado de salud. Cada vez que acude a los lugares de comercialización de animales  siempre se asegura de pedir sus  registros de compra, que le permiten calcular sus ganancias, luego vende esos animales que ha conseguido en las  ferias  ganaderas mas conocidas de la zona. Este negocio le ha resultado rentable porque no invierte casi nada  en mantener a los animales pues los tiene en su poder  por unos días, hasta que llegue el fin de semana, además  la ganancia que recibe por cada cabeza de ganado es considerable. Para el futuro quiere incrementar su capital de trabajo para tener la capacidad de comprar mayor cantidad de  animales.Es la tercera oportunidad que  tiene un crédito y promete ser  muy responsable con sus pagos y agradece  a todas las  personas que hicieron posible el préstamo que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio.Betty tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de mas cabezas de ganado, y de esta manera  incrementará  su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Betty, who is 43 years old, and her small son live with a family member. For 10 years she has made her living purchasing and selling animals. Her brothers help her verify that the animals she acquires are in good health. Each time she goes to the animal commercialization sites, she is sure to ask for her purchase record, which allows her to calculate her profits. She then sells the purchased animals in the most well known livestock markets in the area. This business has been very profitable for her because she hardly invests any money in the maintenance of the animals; she only has them in her care for a few days, until the weekend. Furthermore, the profit she receives for each head of livestock is considerable. In the future, she wants to increase her working capital and be able to purchase a greater quantity of animals. This is her third opportunity to receive a loan, and she promises to be very responsible with her payments. She thanks all those who made the loan possible. It will be very useful to her in advancing her business. Betty plans to invest the requested money in the purchase of additional heads of livestock, and in that way she will increase her working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will purchase several heads of livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Célestine

texts.fr: H. Célestine est née en 1949 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin et vit depuis 40 ans au quartier Gankpodo à Cotonou. Célestine est mère de deux enfants qui ne sont plus à sa charge. C'est une veuve, qui vit seule et assure seule ses besoins. Célestine n'a pas été à l'école. Pour se prendre en charge, Célestine mène comme activité, la vente de produits vivriers (riz, maïs, etc.) à son domicile. Célestine s'approvisionne au marché de Houègbo dans le département de l'Atlantique. Célestine exerce cette activité depuis 30 ans et a déjà bénéficié de cinq crédits qui ont été tous bien remboursés. Célestine désire augmenter le stock de ses produits et mieux satisfaire ses clients. C'est pourquoi Célestine sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un sixième prêt.
texts.en:
H. Célestine was born in 1949 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, and has been living for forty years in the Gankpodo district in Cotonou.  She is the mother of two children, who are no longer in her care.  She is a widow who lives alone supporting herself.  She did not attend school.  To provide for herself, Célestine has a business selling staple foods (rice, corn, etc.) out of her home.  She gets her supplies from the Houègbo market in Atlantique County.  She has been in this business for thirty years and has already benefited from five loans, which have been repaid.  Célestine would like to increase her stock of goods and to satisfy her customers more.  This is why she's requesting a sixth loan from ALIDé. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying grains (sacks of corn, rice, etc.)

loans.name: María Lorenza

texts.en:
María Lorenza is part of the Los Diamantes communal bank. This bank, whose name means “The Diamonds” in English, consists of 32 members all hailing from the Cuzco area. María Lorenza is a 49-year-old mother of three who is separated from her spouse. She lives in the city of Cuzco. Two of her children are currently studying in local universities.

María Lorenza makes a living selling food from a small kiosk on the street. Here she sells soups and other lunch items. On Sundays, she also engages in the buying and selling of grains. María Lorenza says that she will use her Kiva loan for two things: to help grow her small business and to pay for her children’s studies. 

María Lorenza is appreciative and thankful for the loan, and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To grow her business and pay for school tuition

loans.name: Doudou

texts.fr: Monsieur Doudou D. est un sculpteur de 42 ans qui habite à Bagdad Guediawaye. Il est sociétaire de la caisse depuis juin 2009. Il est marie et père de 5 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 2 et 17 ans. Sa spécialité  est la fabrication d’objets d’art, secteur dans lequel il capitalise une expérience de 12 ans. Auparavant il se procurait des objets d’art qu’il revendait sur le marche. C’est par la suite qu’il s’est rendu compte que la fabrication était plus bénéfique  d’autant plus que la rentabilité  augmente pendant la saison touristique. Il sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs destine a l’achat de bois pour la sculpture. En même  temps Monsieur D.  est gardien dans une société  de la place. Mais son salaire ne lui permet pas de couvrir l’intégralité des dépenses familiales. Par conséquent  le prêt lui permettra d’améliorer la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
Mr. Doudou D. is a 42-year-old sculptor who lives in Bagdad Guediawaye.  He has been a member of the credit association since June 2009.  He is married and the father of five children, who range from 2 to 17 years of age.  His specialty is making art objects, a sector in which he capitalizes on twelve years of experience.  In the past, he used to acquire art objects that he resold.  He later realized that making art was more worthwhile, particularly since profitability increases during tourist season. Doudou is requesting a loan of 150,000 francs for buying wood for sculptures.  Meanwhile, he is a security guard at a local company.  But his salary doesn't allow him to cover all of the family expenses.  Consequently, the loan will enable him to do better managing his day-to-day costs. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering his working capital

loans.name: Juana Hermelinda

texts.es: Doña Juana T. cuenta con 39 años de edad, es casada de oficios Artesana, “Confección de Delantales Típicos”  habita junto a sus 3 hijos conjuntamente con su esposo, Ella y su esposo se dedican al mismo oficio, lleva 8 años de Confeccionar su residencia se encuentra en el Paraje Xesiguan, Cantón Xantún, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que ella pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a sus hijos, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Juana T. is 39 years old, is married, and lives with her husband and her three children in the Xantún canton, in Totonicapán, Guatemala. She and her husband have made traditional aprons at home for eight years. Her customers' demands have increased, but Juana's economic conditions have not kept pace and she finds it difficult to increase her working capital. This is why she has come to Kiva partner Asociación ASDIR - to request a loan to buy raw materials and in that way, increase her sales. She hopes to be able to support her children and provide them with better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Susy

texts.es: Susy tiene 47 años y vive sola en su casa propia. Desde hace 3 Años se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte, por el cual cuenta con su propia movilidad, recorriendo así, las principales calles de la ciudad, la misma ruta ya establecida desde hace mucho. Contrato a un chofer,  por lo que se dedica ella en cobrar los pasajes, la mayoría de veces.  El servicio que brinda lo hace todos los días incluyendo los fines de semana y a pesar de haber tenido dificultades  como el alza del precio del combustible, no ha dejado de ofrecer eficientemente este servicio, con tal de salir adelante, pese a las pocas ganancias que tiene algunos días. Es por eso que desea tener otro carro más, que brinde este servicio y así poder subir sus ganancias. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP y siempre ha demostrado ser responsable con sus pagos, por lo que reconfirma nuevamente su responsabilidad. El crédito que solicita, será invertido en la compra de algunos repuestos para su carro, así como el pago de la revisión técnica y reparación de su vehículo.
texts.en:
Susy is 47 years old and lives by herself in her own home. For the last three years, she has provided transportation services - she has her own vehicle in which she drives through the main city streets, a route she established a long time ago. Since she hired a driver, her main duty consists in handling the money. Susy works every day, including weekends, and despite having encountered problems (like the increase in fuel prices), she has not stopped offering her efficient services, which is difficult because of the low profit she makes. Susy would like to one day buy another vehicle in order to increase her profits. This is her fourth loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she has always been responsible with her payments. The loan she is requesting will be used to repair her current vehicle - buy parts and pay the mechanic.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repairing her vehicle

loans.name: Cecile

texts.fr: Cette dame est mariée et mère de 03 enfants, son époux est un mécanicien et ils vivent ensemble dans le quartier d’aguiarkomé qui est un quartier périphérique de Lomé. En 1998 elle a débuté le commerce de produits pharmaceutique, elle s’approvisionne à Accra, ainsi le coût d’achat  lui revient moins chère et elle réalise ainsi de meilleures profits. son stock a baissé, elle voudrait se réapprovisionner et  sollicite donc de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 5 cartons de seringue,6 cartons de paracétamol et divers autres produits pharmaceutiques.
texts.en:
This is lady who is married and the mother of three children.  Her husband is a mechanic, and they live together in Aguiarkomé, an outlying district of Lomé.  In 1998, she started a pharmaceuticals business.  She gets her supplies from Accra, so the purchase price is less expensive for her. She realizes better profits in this way.  Her inventory is low.  She would like to stock up again and is therefore requesting a loan from WAGES for buying five boxes of syringes, six boxes of Paracétamol (reduces pain and fever), and other pharmaceutical products.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying pharmaceutical products

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.fr: D. Bernadette est née le 20 Mai 1961 à Athiémé et vit depuis près de 20 ans au quartier Hlacomey à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à ADJAGBONI Jean Charles, Bernadette est mère de quatre enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Bernadette vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari à Hlacomey. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges familiales. Bernadette n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Depuis une dizaine d'année, en vue d'assurer les différents besoins de ses enfants, Bernadette vend des tenues et des chaussures, par le système de distribution. C'est à Lomé au Togo, Etat voisin du Bénin, que Bernadette s'approvisionne. Bernadette est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant bénéficié de cinq crédits qui ont été tous bien remboursés. Face à la demande importante de sa clientèle en ses produits, Bernadette sollicite un autre prêt en vue d'augmenter le stock de ses produits et de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
D. Bernadette was born on May 20, 1961 in Athiémé and has been living for nearly twenty years in the Hlacomey district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  Married to GBONI Jean Charles, she is the mother of four children, who have attended school. She lives together with her children and husband in Hlacomey.  The couple jointly ensure that their various family expenses are covered.  Bernadette did not attend school. For ten years ago, with the aim of meeting the various needs of her children, she has been selling outfits and shoes by the distribution system.  She gets her supplies from Lomé, in Togo, a country neighboring Benin.  She is a previous ALIDé client having benefited from five loans, which have all been prepaid.  Facing the significant demand for products from her customers, Bernadette is requesting another loan to increase her stock of goods and to respond better to the requirements of her customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying shoes and clothing

loans.name: Good Samaritan Group

texts.en:
Sia F. is the leader of a group five borrowers called Good Samaritan. She is 49 years old and married with four children aged 13 to 36 years old.  She did not have the opportunity to go to school.

For 20 years, Sia has been selling building materials at the Johnson Compound in Paynesville, a town on the outskirts of Liberia's capital, Monrovia. She sells standard commodities and says she has a good relationship with customers, which keeps them returning. Sia started selling with 500 Liberian dollars (about $8 USD at today's exchange rate) as working capital, and her business at the time was selling peanuts.

She faces challenges in transporting goods to market and faces stiff competition from competitors.  She plans to use her 14,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 62,000 Liberian dollar group loan to purchase additional building materials for her business. Her goal is to grow, be prosperous and get a good standard of living. 

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Sia is the one holding the sign.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

Join the Team LEAP - Liberia lending team on Kiva today: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=10019

loans.use: To purchase more goods to sell.

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.es: Doña Antonieta C. cuenta con 48 años de edad, es casada de oficios Artesana, “Confección de Delantales Típicos”  habita junto a sus 2 hijos conjuntamente con su esposo, Ella y su esposo se dedican al mismo oficio, lleva 18 años de Confeccionar su residencia se encuentra en el Paraje Xesiguan, Cantón Xantún, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que ella pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a sus hijos, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Antonieta C. is 48 years old, is married, and lives with her husband and her two children in the Xantún canton, in Totonicapán, Guatemala. She and her husband have made traditional aprons at home for 18 years. Her customers' demands have increased, but Antonieta's economic conditions have not kept pace and she finds it difficult to increase her working capital. This is why she has come to Kiva partner Asociación ASDIR - to request a loan to buy raw materials and in that way, increase her sales. She hopes to be able to support her children and provide them with better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: The Blessing Of God Family Group

texts.en:
Mardea B. is the leader of a five-borrower group called The Blessing Of God Family. She is 38 years old, single, and has two children, aged 16 and 6 years old. She was not able to graduate from high school due to lack of financial support.

For more than 9 years, Mardea has been selling charcoal at the Gaye Town market on Old Road in Monrovia, Liberia. She started by helping a lady who was in charcoal sales.

Mardea sells her goods at a stable price, which keeps her customers returning. Sometimes, however, she has problems with the poor quality of the bulk charcoal she buys. She plans to use her 9,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 39,000 Liberian dollar group loan to purchase more charcoal in bulk to resell.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Mardea is the one holding the sign. Musu Kiazolu is inset at the lower right.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal in bulk for resale.

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justina is part of the Los Diamantes community bank. This bank, whose name means “The Diamonds” in English, consists of 32 members all hailing from the Cuzco area. Justina is originally from Vilcabamba, a historic city that served as the last refuge of the Inca Empire. However, Justina has been living in the city of Cuzco for many years. She is 38 years old and lives with her spouse and her 9-year-old child, who is currently enrolled in a local elementary school. 

Justina makes a living selling artisan goods. She sells mostly woven goods but also some metal items, and buys the raw materials from local wholesalers. She sells these artisan goods in the Plaza de Armas, a main tourist hub of the city. Justina makes 180 soles per day on average, around 60 US dollars. 

Justina will use her loan from Kiva to further her artisan business. She is appreciative and thankful for the loan, and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: For materials to make artisan goods

loans.name: María Luciana

texts.es: Doña María R. cuenta con 39 años de edad, es casada de oficios Artesana, “Confección de Delantales Típicos”  habita junto a sus 2 hijos conjuntamente con su esposo, Ella y su esposo se dedican al mismo oficio, lleva 18 años de Confeccionar su residencia se encuentra en el Paraje Xesiguan, Cantón Xantún, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que ella pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a sus hijos, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. María R. is 39 years old, is married, and lives with her husband and her two children in the Xantún canton, in Totonicapán, Guatemala. She and her husband have made traditional aprons at home for 18 years. Her customers' demands have increased, but María's economic conditions have not kept pace and she finds it difficult to increase her working capital. This is why she has come to Kiva partner Asociación ASDIR - to request a loan to buy raw materials and in that way, increase her sales. She hopes to be able to support her children and provide them with better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Sebastiana Cristina

texts.es:
La señora Cristina pertenece al Banco Comunal San Juan Eudes en la ciudad de Montecristi en la provincia Manabí en esta ciudad sus habitantes son la  gran mayoría artesanos se dedican a la elaboración de muebles, tiene 53 años de edad y 18 años que formó su hogar en los actuales momentos vive con el esposo y un hijo, ya sus demás hijos son adultos y están radicados en el Oriente.

La señora Cristina desde hace 10 ciclos forma parte de la Fundación Espoir junto a ella ha podido crecer en sus negocios a los largo de 6 años que empezó con la despensa no ha dejado de trabajar y cada día se entrega mas a su negocio, ella nos cuenta que su esposo en los actúales momentos no tiene trabajo y es quien le ayuda en cuanto a atender la despensa, 

por otra parte la señora Cristina nos comentó que también se dedica a vender productos a base de paja toquilla, ella se encarga de la elaboración y venta de los mismos y una vez terminados los lleva hasta la ciudad de Guayaquil donde los vende, a los almacenes, nuestra socia es una mujer bastante trabajadora, se da tiempo para estar al pendiente de sus dos negocios.

Con este nuevo crédito la señora Cristina invertirá una parte en la despensa en comprar productos de primera necesidad como también bebidas, y la otra parte será en materiales para elaborar sus trabajos en paja toquilla como abastecerse de la materia prima.
texts.en:
Cristina belongs to the Communal Bank San Juan Eudes, located in the city of Montecristi, Manabí province. Most residents of this city are craftspeople and furniture makers. Cristina is 53 years old, and has been married for 18 years. She lives with her husband and one of her children - the others are grown and live in western Ecuador. Cristina has been with Fundación Espoir for 10 cycles and she has grown her little grocery store for the last six years. She has never stopped working and every day she puts everything into her business. She tells us that her husband is currently unemployed and he helps her at the grocery store. Cristina also sells Panama hats; she makes the hats, and once finished, she takes them to the city of Guayaquil to sell in the stores there. Cristina is a hardworking woman and she makes time to take care of her two businesses. With this loan, Cristina will buy products and drinks for her grocery store and raw materials to make her Panama hats.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying raw materials and supplies for her store

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en:
Alberto is part of the Los Diamantes communal bank. This bank, whose name means “The Diamonds” in English, consists of 32 members, all hailing from the Cuzco area. Alberto is 38 years old and lives with his spouse and their 1-year-old child. 

Alberto makes his living in the construction business as a topographer. He is involved in the construction of houses and is currently also working near Machu Picchu to fix damage done by the recent flooding there. 

Alberto will use his loan from Kiva to help his construction business. He is appreciative of and thankful for the loan, and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: Construction supplies

loans.name: Regina Isabel

texts.es: Doña Regina Isabel Ordóñez Puác cuenta con 26 años de edad,  casada vive conjuntamente con su esposo y un  hijos, actualmente se dedica prestando sus servicios como amarradora de jaspe y tejedora, durante 5 años y por las condiciones a la que ella vive no son suficientes por lo que se acercó a las oficinas de la asociación Asdir  por un préstamo,  debido a los bajos ingresos que obtiene semanalmente, no son suficientes actualmente su esposo está estudiando para obtener un título del nivel medio por lo que ella quiere salir avante con su familia comprando materia prima para obtener su propio taller de fabricación de cortes típicos. Así poder darle a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Mrs. Regina Isabel Ordóñez Puác is 26 years old, is married, and lives with her husband and her child. She has worked as a weaver for the last five years, but her income is not enough. Her husband is attending school to obtain his High School diploma, and she has approached Kiva partner Asociación ASDIR to ask for a loan to buy raw materials in order to get her own workshop to make traditional garments, and give her family a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying raw materials

loans.name: Dédé Ememe

texts.fr:
Cette dame exerce comme activité la vente de produits d'alimentations générale. Elle exerce ce commerce depuis plus de 15 ans déjà et les revenus lui permettent de contribuer aux dépenses de sa famille. La qualité de ses services  fait qu’elle est très reconnue dans son quartier. Elle vend à toutes personnes
Elle fait face en ce moment à une baisse de stock et les difficultés financières qu’elle traverse  font qu’elle ne peut se réapprovisionner, elle sollicite donc de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 4 boîtes de sardines, 10 paniers de tomates, 3 cartons de Lait, 1 cartons de spaghetti et divers produits d'alimentation générale
texts.en:
This woman's business is selling general food products. She has already been doing this business for over 15 years and the income enables her to contribute to paying her family's expenses. The quality of her service has made her very well-known in her neighborhood. She sells to everyone. Right now she has very little stock and is having some financial difficulties. For this reason she can't restock her business. She is thus asking WAGES for a loan to purchase 4 boxes of sardines, 10 baskets of tomatoes, 3 boxes of milk, 1 box of spaghetti and various other general food products.

Translated from French by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase general food products

loans.name: Aracely Del Rocio

texts.es:
La señora Aracely es una de las socias que forma parte del Banco Comunal San Juan Eudes que se reúne en la ciudad de Montecristi en la provincia de Manabí.

nuestra socia tiene como ocupación, un almacén de repuestos eléctricos para vehículos, además de eso también aun mantiene un negocio que es la venta de camarones por libra, este negocio tiene  12 años y era el esposo que lo administraba, una vez que el falleció ella lo tomó, por otra parte el negocio de los repuestos tiene 5 años y fue motivada por su compadre que es  técnico en electricidad, así decidió la señora Aracely poner su almacén en un espacio de la casa, ahora que  nuestra socia es padre y madre en su hogar tiene que atender los dos negocios, con los prestamos que ha recibido de la Fundación ha podido invertir y hacer crecer sus ventas.

Con este nuevo crédito la señora Aracely invertirá en comprar una vitrina y repuestos como cables,  luces, alógenos, focos, y demás repuestos y la otra parte del dinero está destinado en comprar camarones por libra para hacer la entrega a los clientes desde su domicilio.
texts.en:
Aracely is a member of Communal Bank San Juan Eudes in the city of Montecristi, Manabí province. She owns a store that sells electrical parts for vehicles, and a business selling shrimp by the pound. Aracely has had this last business for 12 years and her late husband was the one who managed it. When he died, she started managing it herself. She has owned the auto parts store for five years, and her motivation to starting it came from her child's godfather, who is a mechanic. She decided to run her store from her home, and now, being mother and father to her children, she runs both businesses. With the loans she has received from Kiva partner Fundación ESPOIR, she has invested in and grown both. With this last loan, Aracely will buy a display case for cables, halogen lights, light bulbs, and other auto parts. She will also buy shrimp by the pound to sell and deliver to customers.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying a display case

loans.name: Emerson Eduardo

texts.es: El señor Emerson Eduardo T. B. cuenta con 21 años, casado tiene una hija vive con sus familia actualidad el se dedica a la artesanía en la elaboración de cortes típicos por las condiciones en las que vive no son suficientes para cubrir sus gastos personales por lo que se acerco a las intalaciones de la asociación ASDIR para adquirir un préstamo para poder comprar su propia materia prima según su experiencia en su trabajo quiere obtener un pequeño taller para la elaboración de cortes típicos mejorando así sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia. Sufragando sus gastos personales mensualmente.
texts.en:
Emerson Eduardo T. B. is 21 years old and lives with his wife and daughter. He is a craftsman who makes traditional clothing, but his income is currently not enough to cover his personal expenses. This is why he came to Kiva partner Asociacion ASDIR - to request a loan to buy raw materials and get a little workshop in which to make traditional clothing in order to better his and his family's living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying raw materials

loans.name: Lidia Monica

texts.en:
Lidia Monica is part of the Los Diamantes (The Diamonds) communal bank. The bank consists of 32 members, all hailing from the Cuzco area. Lidia is 34 years old and lives with her spouse and their two children in the city of Cuzco. 

Lidia Monica makes a living in the auto repair industry, buying car parts and using them to fix the cars of her clients. She owns this business with one other person. Lidia Monica plans on using the Kiva loan to buy more car parts so she can grow her business. She is appreciative of and thankful for the loan, and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

In the photo, Lidia Monica is pictured with her daughter.

loans.use: Car parts for car repair business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Flour, meat and oil for a fried food stand

loans.name: Cristina Ramona

texts.es: La señora Cristina Ramona  cuenta con 36 años de edad, casada viven con sus tres hijos actual mente ella reside en el lugar conocido como Caserío Tzamnimasac, del municipio y departamento de Totonicapán Guatemala ella se dedica al comercio en venta de ropa casual para caballeros por las necesidades personales y la de su familia se acercó a las instalaciones de la Asociación Asdir para adquirir un préstamo ya que la demanda de sus clientes son muchas, por lo que ella requiere de más capital para poder surtir su mercadería y como tambien de ampliar y distribuir mejor su negocio en otros lugares ayudando así a familia dándole a sus hijos una mejor condición de vida y educación.
texts.en:
Mrs. Cristina Ramona is 36 years old, is married, and lives with her three children. Currently, she lives in Caserío Tzamnimasac in Totonicapán, Guatemala. She sells casual clothing for men. Because of her family's needs, Cristina went to Kiva partner Asociación ASDIR. She asks for a loan which she will use to meet the many demands of her customers. She needs more capital to buy goods and to expand her business to other locations. In this way, she will help her family and will give her children better conditions and an education.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Isaura

texts.es: Isaura F. D. C. D. 60 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como albañil, y así mismo junto a su pequeño nieto D. 2 años y medio D. edad. Isaura es una mujer muy trabajadora, quien se dedica a trabajar elaborando muebles D. madera, tales como: tocadores, mesas, roperos y otros más. Cuenta con una gran experiencia, ya que desD. hace 21 años que se dedica a este oficio, tiempo a través del cual se ha hecho D. renombre por ser alguien muy trabajadora, responsable y dedicada a su trabajo, esto le ha permitido contar con muchos clientes, incluso surte algunas mueblerías las cuales están ubicadas en  el puerto D.
