La Libertad, lo que le permite contar muy buenas ganancias. Isaura solicita un préstamo a Integral, a través del cual pueda comprar madera D. cedro por mayor, ya que ella cuenta con muchos pedidos los cuales desea poder cubrir, ya que en ocasiones se ha atrasado e incluso negado a hacer ciertos trabajos por falta D. materia prima. Es por esta razón que ella desea contar con el dinero necesario y así mejorar su negocio. Isaura es una mujer muy trabajador la cual se dedica a un trabajo bastante duro, todo con el fin D. poder seguir adelante y poder contar con todo lo necesario para vivir.
texts.en:
Isaura F. D. C. is 60 years old and lives in the department of La Libertad with her husband (a bricklayer) and her two-and-a-half year old grandson. Isaura is a very hard-working woman who makes wood furniture items such as tables, dressers, wardrobes, etc. She has a lot of experience as she has been practicing this traD. since she was 21. She has developed a reputation for being responsible and dedicated to her work. These qualities have allowed her to make and keep several clients, including some furniture stores in La Libertad, and to make a good living. Isaura requests this loan from Integral to purchase additional cedar wood (at wholesale) so that she has enough raw materials to fulfill all of her orders. Unfortunately, at times she has been unable to take orders, or has been late in completing orders, due to a lack of access to enough raw material. Therefore, this loan will allow her to improve her business. As a dedicated, hard-working entrepeneur, Isaura continues to move forward and to proviD. for herself and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jim Muir, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cedar wood (raw material)

loans.name: Patricia Maria Ruth

texts.es:
Patricia C. de 54 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Suburbio de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, su esposo es chofer en una empresa, todos sus hijos están casados. 

Patricia aprendió desde pequeña a cocinar con la ayuda de su madre. Cuando creció y tuvo su familia no tenía mucho dinero como mantenerla y decidió vender almuerzos en su casa a sus vecinos.

Ahora diario vende 30 almuerzos a empleados del sector, pero todavía los vende en su casa. También ha implementado poner cabinas telefónicas para tener otro ingreso adicional. Con el préstamo quiere  comprar cemento, piedra, bloques para construir un local. 

En el futuro quiere tener un local solo para las cabinas y en otro local un restaurante que cumpla con todas las exigencias de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Patricia C. is 54 years old and lives in the urban area of El Surburbio in Guayaquil. Her house is made of cement and receives all of the basic services. Her husband is employed by a business as a chauffeur. All of her children are married.

Patricia learned to cook at a young age with the help of her mother. When she grew up and had her own family, she did not have much money to support them, so she decided to prepare lunches at home and sell them to her neighbors. She now sells 30 lunches each day to employees who work in the area, but she still sells them from home. Patricia also installed telephone booths in order to generate additional income. With this loan she plans to buy cement, stone, and blocks so that she can build her own shop.

In the future, she wants to have a separate location for her telephone booths and another location for a restaurant so that she can satisfy all of her customers’ demands.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials so that she can build a shop for her food business

loans.name: María Guadalupe

texts.es: María Guadalupe L. E. de 57 años de edad, reside en San Diego, una de las playas más famosa del país, la cual es muy visitada por miles de turistas en todo el año y que se encuentra ubicada en el departamento de La Libertad, aquí vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como albañil, y junto a sus tres hijos de 22, 20 y 10 años de edad, de los cuales los dos mayores trabajan como pescadores, y el menor se dedica a estudiar. María posee una tienda la cual esta ubicada frente a la playa, en donde cuenta con la ventaja de ser la única que se encuentra en ese lugar, por lo que poseen muchos clientes entre ellos turistas. Ella solicita un préstamo con el fin de poder contar con el dinero necesario para invertir en la tienda, comprando mayor cantidad de productos como: agua embotellada, sodas, jugos y otros más los cuales se venden en grandes cantidades, así mismo María desea contar con más productos, ya que se acerca la semana Santa, una de las épocas del año en que más personas vistan las playas, ya que es una tradición  muy propia de este país, es por esto que María desea contar con todo lo necesario para aprovechar la temporada y así obtener mayores ganancias, lo cual le permita seguir invirtiendo en el negocio.
texts.en:
María Guadalupe L. E. is 57 years old and resides in San Diego, which has one of the most famous beaches in the country. It is visited by thousands of tourists throughout the year and is located in the Department of La Libertad. She lives with her husband, who works as a mason, and their three children (ages 22, 20, and 10). The two older children are adults and work as fishermen, while the youngest is a student. María has a store that is located across from the beach. She has the advantage of being the only establishment there, so she has many customers who are mostly tourists.

María is requesting a loan so that she will have the necessary funds to invest in her store. She will buy a large quantity of products such as bottle water, sodas, juices, and other items that are sold in bulk. At the same time, María wants to have more products because Holy Week is approaching and more people visit the beaches around this time of year. It is a tradition of its own in this part of the country. For this reason, María wants to have everything necessary to take advantage of the season so that she can generate more revenue that will allow her to continue investing in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bottle water, sodas, and juices

location.town: San Diego, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Margot

texts.en:
Margot is part of the Los Diamantes communal bank. This bank, whose name means “The Diamonds” in English, consists of 32 members all hailing from the Cuzco area. Margot is 38 years old and lives with her spouse and their two children (ages 11 and 15) in the city of Cuzco. Her children are both enrolled in local schools. 

Margot makes her living in the decoration industry. Specifically, she makes and sells curtains. She also installs the curtains in clients’ houses. Margot will use her Kiva loan to further this business, buying more materials to increase her production output. 

Margot is appreciative of and thankful for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To buy fabric to make and sell curtains

loans.name: Rosa Pricila

texts.es:
El banco comunal San Juan Eudes se reúne en la ciudad de Montecristi en la costa manabita, este es un gran grupo de socias que se dedican en su gran mayoría a la artesanía y a la pesca.

La señora Priscila de 26 años es casada desde hace 10 años el esposo tuvo que emigrar a  los Estados Unidos en busca de mejores días para el y su familia, de esta relación nació una hija, la señora Priscila  se  dedica a la venta de  productos Avon, su forma de trabajo es salir a recorrer por las tardes  vende a sus amigas a sus familiares, con gran facilidad de cobros para poder mantener la clientela  los productos de belleza los deja a 15 días y en su casa tiene una bisutería donde vende de todo un poco la mercadería que ella vende es de diferente partes como de EE.UU, y elaboraras en el país.

Con este nuevo préstamo la señora Priscila podrá invertir en el negocio como viajara para poder surtir su  vitrina de bisutería como collares, artes, pulsera entre otros y los productos  Avon los compra según el pedido que le hagan los clientes.
texts.en:
The San Juan Eudes Communal Bank meets in the city of Montecristi on the coast of Manabita. This is a large group of members who are mostly dedicated to making handicrafts and fishing.

Sra. Priscila is 26 years old and has been married for ten years to her husband, who went to the United States in search of better days for himself and his family. Their relationship resulted in the birth of her daughter. Sra. Priscila sells Avon products to her friends and relatives in the afternoons. She offers payment options so that she can keep her customers. Priscilla places orders for beauty products every 15 days. At her home, she keeps costume jewelry that she sells to a small trader who then sells it to different parts of the United States. Some of the items are manufactured domestically.

With this new loan, Sra. Priscila will invest in her business by traveling so that she can restock her jewelry case with necklaces, earrings, bracelets, and other items. She will also purchase Avon products based on the requests submitted by her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase necklaces, earrings, bracelets, and other items; acquire cosmetics to fulfill her customers' orders

loans.name: Salaama Development Group, Mukono

texts.en:
L. Dennis, shown in the small photo at the top left, is the same person seated on the right. He is a single father with one child.

To subsist, Dennis is into the business of commercial photography in Salaama village, Mukono district. He has subsisted rather pathetically on this business for the last ten years. This is, in part, due to the low earnings he gets from this business.

This has not been the only low point of Dennis’s business; he also has had to be brought in harsh terms with the reality of many defaulting clients. On the other hand, those clients who have given him steadfast support have, suffice to say, borne testament to his many good business graces. It’s because of this loyal support that he carries conviction that his future business prospects are rosy.

Dennis needs this loan to buy more equipment so that, in future, he can make his own studio where he can take, process and produce his pictures.

loans.use: To buy more equipment like a camera and a film

loans.name: María Eva Del Carmen

texts.es: María Eva del Carmen H. C. de 48 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Usulután, ubicado al oriente del país. Vive junto a su esposo el cual le ayuda con el negocio y junto a su madre de avanzada edad. María posee una venta de frutas y verduras, la cual esta ubicada en el mercado municipal de Santiago de María siempre al oriente del país. Lugar en el cual trabaja desde hace muchos años atrás, es a través de este negocio en que María y su esposo han logrado salir adelante y así contar con una vida digna, en la cual han contado con lo más necesario y básico para sobrevivir. Es por esta razón que María solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para poder invertir más en su negocio, comprando gran variedad de verduras, así como todo tipo de frutas de estación la cual las personas buscan más, tales como mango y jocotes que son muy consumidos en el mes de marzo y abril por razón de las fiestas de Semana Santa en la cual es una tradición consumirlas, es por esto que María desea aprovechar esta temporada y así obtener algo de dinero extra lo cual sea de mucha ayuda para la estabilidad económica de su hogar.
texts.en:
María Eva del Carmen H. C. is 48 years old and resides in the Department of Usulután, which is located in the eastern part of the country. She lives with her husband, who helps with her business, and her elderly mother. María has a fruit and vegetable stand in the Santiago de María Municipal Market, which is also in eastern El Salvador. She and her husband have managed this business for many years and it has helped them move forward so that they can have a decent life. It has provided them with the most basic necessities for them to survive.

For this reason, María is requesting a loan so that she will have the necessary funds to invest in her business. She will buy a variety of vegetables as well as all kinds of seasonal fruits that people are requesting more of, such as mangos and plums. The fruits are greatly consumed in the months of March and April because of the Holy Week festivities. Since more fruit is traditionally purchased around this time, María wants to take advantage of the season so that she can earn extra income to help stabilize her household finances.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits & vegetables

loans.name: Reina De La Paz

texts.es: Reina de la Paz P. de 31 años de edad, reside en Santiago de María, ubicado en el departamento de Usulután. Vive junto a su esposo el cual se dedica a trabajar como albañil y sus dos hijos de 2 y 1 año de edad. Reina posee una venta de frutas y verduras, la cual esta ubicada en el mercado municipal de Santiago de María siempre ubicado al  oriente del país. Desde hace 8 años que ella posee este negocio, por medio del cual ha logrado crecer mucho como persona, ya que ha podido realizar uno de sus sueños el cual era contar con su propio negocio, es así como por medio de esta pueda brindarle ayuda a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, ya que el trabajo de él en muchas ocasiones se vuelve algo inconstante por la falta de contratos, razón por la que Reina solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar mayor cantidad de frutas y verduras, las cuales le permitan contar con más clientes, a los cuales pueda satisfacer todas sus preferencias y deseos. Esto es de gran beneficio tanto para Reina como para su hogar ya que podrá contar con mucho más clientes y más ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Reina de la Paz P. is 31 years old and resides in Santiago de María, located in the Department of Usulután. She lives with her husband, who works as a mason, and their two children (ages 2 and 1). Reina has a vegetable and fruit stand at the Santiago de María municipal market, which is located in the eastern part of the country. For the past eight years she has owned this business, which has enabled her to grow as a person. One of her dreams was to have her own business, so now she is able to help her husband with the household expenses.

On many occasions her work become unstable because of a lack of contracts, so Reina is requesting a loan so that she will have the money to buy more fruits and vegetables. This will allow her to gain more customers since she will be able to satisfy all of their preferences and desires. Having more customers will be of great benefit to Reina because it means she will have more income for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits & vegetables

location.town: Santiago de María, departamento de Usulután

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
El comité Divino Niño Jesús, se forma en el mes de diciembre, a mediados del año 2008. Son del barrio San Antonio de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso; actualmente están 23 señoras.

Son un grupo que en su mayoría se dedican a la venta de mercaderías de primera mano, como ser ( aceite, leche, jabón, leche, papel higiénico, entre otros . Agradecen infinitamente a KIVA Y la Fundación Paraguaya por la oportunidad brindada.
Una de las integrantes es la señora trabaja en una despensa que posee en su casa (venta de productos de uso domésticos).En la despensa se ofrecen todo tipo de productos, ella atiende el negocio con la ayuda de su familia y tratan de manejarla de la mejor manera posible ya que es muy importante en cuanto a la ayuda que brinda con los gastos de la casa.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de mercaderías para la despensa como; arroz, fideos, lácteos,panificados, y otros.
texts.en:
The “Divino Niño Jesús” group was created in December, 2008. It is comprised of 23 women from the San Antonio neighborhood in the city of Mariano Roque Alonso.

They are primarily dedicated to the sale of basic goods such as cooking oil, milk, soap, toilet tissue, among others. They are profoundly grateful to KIVA and the Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity offered to them. One of the group members works in a store she operates from within her house (selling products for home use). She sells all types of products in her store and she, herself, runs the business with the help of her family. They try to run it in the most efficient manner possible as it helps them cover their housing expenses.

She is requesting a loan in order to purchase more goods for her store, such as rice, pasta, dairy products, and baked goods, among others.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Huthnance, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase baked goods, dairy products, canned goods, pasta, rice, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Ana Josefa

texts.es: Ana Josefa D. D. R. D. 63 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. Usulután. Vive junto a dos nietos D. 12 años D. edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar y a ayudarle a su abuela con el negocio. Ana posee una tortillería, en la cual se encarga D. hacer tortillas para vender al mediodía y en las tardes, las cuales venD. en su propia casa y otras las cuales sus nietos le ayudan a repartirlas por las diferentes casas D. sus clientes. Cuenta con gran número D. personas que consumen las tortillas que ella comercializa y   los cuales le compran su productos desD. hace 10 años, tiempo el cual Ana a aprendido a ganarse la vida trabajando D. esta manera, el cual es un trabajo bastante duro pero que resulta ser muy rentable. Debido a que es ella quien se encarga D. cuidar y brindarles el alimento y hogar a sus nietos, ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual  pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. maíz, leña, y cal, lo cual es la materia prima para elaborar y cocinar las tortillas. Ana desea mucho poder contar con más clientes para poder percibir más ganancias, ya que ella desea poder brindarles una vida mejor a sus dos pequeños nietos, los cuales son una D. las mayores razones por las que se esfuerza cada día para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Ana Josefa D. D. R., 63 years of age, lives in the department of Usulután with two grandchildren who are 12 years old. They attend school and help their grandmother with the business. Ana owns a tortilla business; she sells them at midday and afternoons. She sells some from her home, and others she sells at her customers’ homes with the help of her grandchildren. She has a good customer base that has been buying her tortillas for 10 years, during which time Ana has learned how to make a living in this endeavor. The business is hard work, but profitable. Since it is she who solely provides food and a home for her grandchildren, she requests a loan for buying corn, wood, and lime at wholesale, as these items are key to her making and selling of the tortillas. Ana hopes very much to attract more customers so she can increase her earnings. This will allow her to proviD. a better life for her two young grandchildren, who are one of the main reasons she puts forth great effort each day to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase corn, wood and lime.

loans.name: Ana Alicia

texts.es: Ana Alicia A. D. S. D. 47 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. Usulután, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo y dos hijas menores D. edad, las cuales se dedican a estudiar. DesD. hace 8 años que Ana posee una venta D. tortillas, en la cual se encarga D. elaborarlas y venderlas. Este negocio nació con el deseo D. poder mejorar la economía familiar, ya que en muchas ocasiones no se contaba con el dinero necesario para solventar todos los gastos del hogar. Es por esta razón que Ana desea poder seguir creciendo  con el negocio que le ha brindado estabilidad económica a su familia. Ana solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar maíz por mayor, D. manera que pueda obtenerlo a precios más accesible, así mismo comprar cilindros D. gas propano con el fin D. contar con una reserva D. este último, ya que en muchas ocasiones escasea y D. esta manera no se verá afectada como en otros años. Esto será D. mucho ayuda para ella, ya que podrá mejorar las condiciones D. su negocio y así contar con más clientela.
texts.en:
Ana Alicia A. D. S., 47 years of age, lives in the department of Usulután with her husband and two school-aged children. For the past 8 years, Ana has had a business making and selling tortillas. Her business was born from a desire to help her family financially, given that oftentimes they did not have enough income to cover household expenses. For this reason, Ana wishes to continue growing the business, an endeavor that has helped stabilize the family economically. Ana requests a loan in order to buy corn at wholesale, as this would allow her to obtain it at a better price. In addition, she would like to buy some propane gas tanks to have in reserve. At times, propane is scarce, and having some additional tanks would keep her business from being affected when there are fuel shortages. This problem has affected her in the past. These items would be a great help to her, as she would be able to improve her business and attract more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn and propane gas.

loans.name: Juan Alejandro

texts.es:
Este Sr. Se llama Juan Alejandro V., es soltero y sin hijos y con una carga familiar de su mamá y dos sobrinos los cuales están en edad escolar. 
Juan Alejandro hace 20 años se dedicaba a vender lotería en el mercado municipal de Chichigalpa, pero como ese negocio no le dejaba muchas ganancias decidió ahorrar para poner una venta en su casa de habitación que es en el reparto Carlos Fonseca Nº 1, actualmente se dedica al comercio, tiene una pulpería desde hace 4 años, y lleva por nombre ¨ Pulpería Juancito¨ donde vende granos básicos, Pollo, Carnes, Huevos, Enlatados, Gaseosas de todos los sabores.
Ceprodel le ha financiado 5 créditos  desde el año 2007, y todos han sido para invertir más en el negocio y en esta ocasión quiere comprar un Freezer para meter todo lo que es carne, pollo y lácteos.
texts.en:
This is Juan. He is single and has no children, but he supports his mother and two school-aged nephews. He’d been selling lottery tickets in the Chichigalpa market for the past 20 years, but this didn’t provide much of an income, so four years ago he decided to save his money and start and run a general store out of his home. He calls it “Pulpería Juancito,” and he sells basic grains, poultry, meats, eggs, canned goods, and different flavors of soft drinks. CEPRODEL helped him to obtain five loans in the 2007, all to invest into his business. He will use the money from this loan to buy a freezer in which to store the meats, poultry, and milk products.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Freezer

loans.name: Ana Lisseth

texts.es: Ana Lisseth R. G. de 24 años de edad, reside en el departamento de San Salvador, junto a su madre la cual trabaja como ama del hogar, y su hermana de 31 años de edad, y un sobrino. Ana posee un Ciber café, el cual esta ubicado en su propia casa, en una de las zonas más concurridas de su colonia, ya que esta frente a la iglesia católica del lugar, lo cual es de mucho beneficio para ella ya que se encuentra en un lugar muy visible. Ana solicita un préstamo a Integral, a través del cual pueda obtener el dinero necesario para invertir en el negocio, compran productos como CDs, folders,  etiquetas, lapiceros, papelería y otros más, los cuales las personas buscan mucho, sobre todo por estudiantes. A pesar de su corta edad Ana es una joven muy llena de deseos de poder triunfar en la vida y así poder seguir adelante con sus estudios, y contar con un mejor futuro para su ella.
texts.en:
Ana Lisseth R. G., 24 years of age, lives in the San Salvador department along with her mother, a homemaker, her 31-year old sister, and a nephew. Ana runs an Internet café that is located in her own home, within one of the busiest areas of the zone. It is in front of the local Catholic Church, which is a good location since the business has a high visibility. Ana requests a loan from Integral, which would give her access to the necessary funds to invest in her business. She would like to buy products such as CDs, folders, labels, pens, paper products, and more, all of which are in great demand, particularly by students. Despite her young age, Ana is filled with a desire to succeed, to continue with her education, and to be able to build a better future for herself.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy CDs, pens, and paper products.

loans.name: Mileidy

texts.es:
Mileidy S. P.  es una señora de 36 años de edad la cual vive solamente con sus 2 hijos en una comunidad llamada Santa Fe localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa y por estar muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, caña de azúcar, naranja.

Doña mileidy  desde hace algunos años inicio su propio negocio una pulpería. Ella pensó que fue una excelente idea ya  que el negocio que existía no satisfacía la demanda de la comunidad.  Con este negocio ha logrado tener  una actividad económica rentable que la ayuda a mejorar su calidad de vida. Pero en este momento  su local se ha deteriorado  y necesita mejorar las condiciones de este para seguir teniendo éxito con su negocio.

Actualmente ella necesita un préstamo por ¢665.000 (seiscientos sesenta y cinco  mil colones) para comprar los materiales necesarios para reconstruir su local y poder seguir con su negocio que tanto le ha ayudado a superarse y sacar adelante a sus 2 hijos. Asegura que mejorar su negocio es muy importante ya que por medio de él es que ha podido superarse por su propia cuenta. 

Doña Mileidy es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Manantial de Santa Fe, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer  préstamo y con él espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito pueden ayudar a muchas mujeres a superarse por sí solas.
texts.en:
Mileidy S. P. is a 36-year old woman who lives alone with her 2 children in a community called Los Chiles, located in the Alajuela province. This community is known for being mountainous and for its proximity to our country’s northern border. Her primary activities are raising livestock and farming, more specifically, the planting of basic grains, sugar cane, and citrus. A few years ago, Mileidy started her own general store business. She thought this an excellent idea, since the businesses that existed in the area did not meet the community’s needs. With this business, she has managed to become profitable and improve her standard of living. However, currently, her business location has deteriorated and she needs to improve conditions so that her business can succeed. She needs a loan of 665,000 colones to buy the necessary materials to rebuild her locale and continue with her business, one that has greatly helped her and her 2 children get ahead. She assures us that refurbishing her business is very important since, by this means, she has been able to succeed on her own. Mileidy is a member of the Manantial de Santa Fe cooperative bank, one of the 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This would be her first loan and, through it, she hopes to grow both personally and financially. She also stresses that it is thanks to these types of organizations, which facilitate access to credit, that many women have managed to get ahead on their own.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make improvements to her business locale.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa O. D. R. 54 años D. edad, resiD. en Santiago D. María, ubicado en el departamento D. Usulután, el cual se encuentra en el oriente del país. Vive junto a su hijo el cual trabaja como empleado para una empresa privada. Rosa se dedica a la venta D. papas fritas, las cuales las ofrece con catsup, queso rallado y mayonesa. Su negocio esta ubicado en el punto D. buses del transporte publico los cuales transportan a las personas desD. la capital del país hasta Santiago D. María, ubicación la cual es muy estratégica ya que muchas D.  las personas que viajan a este lugar consumen D. sus productos para poder calmar el hambre provocada por el viaje. D. esta manera Rosa se gana la vida, teniendo cada día la esperanza D. poder ganar un poco más que el día anterior. Ella solicita un préstamo con el deseo D. poder contar con el dinero necesario para invertir en el negocio, comprando papas, queso, salsa D. tomate, aceite y gas, D. manera que pueda contar con mayor cantidad D. materia prima para poder atender a más clientes. Todo esto es con la esperanza D. mejorar su negocio y al mismo tiempo sus ventas, lo cual es primordial para Rosa ya que es esta la única fuente D. ingresos que posee.
texts.en:
Rosa O. D. R., 54 years of age, lives in Santiago D. María of the Usulután region, located in the eastern part of the country. She lives with her son, who is an employee at a private enterprise. Rosa dedicates herself to selling French fries, which she sells with catsup, grated cheese and mayonnaise. Her business is located near a bus station, where people travel from the capital to Santiago D. María. This is a very strategic location since many travelers stop to buy her products, as they are hungry after the trip. This is how Rosa makes a living, hoping each day to earn a little more than the previous day. She is requesting a loan to have funds to invest into her business, to buy items such as potatoes, cheese, tomato sauce, oil, and gas. Having more ingredients and supplies will allow her to better tend to her customers. She does all this with the hopes of improving her business and, simultaneously, her sales. This is a key goal for Rosa, since her business is her sole source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy potatoes, cheese, tomato sauce, oil and gas.

location.town: Santiago de María, departamento de Usulután

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
La señora Lidia Q.  vive en casa propia tiene 1  hija. La misma se dedica a la costura y venta de ropas, posee maquinas de cocer en su domicilio en la cuidad de Luque y un local de venta de ropas en la ciudad de Fernando de la Mora.
 A la fecha la titular ha retirado un préstamo para la compra de telas para realizar trabajos ya que posee varios pedidos que le estaría dejando buenos ingresos para la unidad familiar.
La  titular opera con la Fundación Paraguaya desde el año  2003  abonando en fecha todos sus  prestamos, y a la ves  le han ayudado para su inversión y mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lidia Q. lives in her own home and has a daughter. She makes her living sewing and selling clothing; she has sewing machines in her home. She lives in the city of Luque and has a shop where she sells clothing in the city of Fernando de la Mora. As of today, Mrs. Q. has taken out a loan to buy fabric so she can finish some work she has pending, work that is earning her a good income for her family. She has been working with Fundación Paraguaya since 2003 and has paid all of her loans on time. The loans have helped her invest and improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase food products to prepare and sell dishes and meals

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia is part of the Los Diamantes communal bank. This bank, whose name means “The Diamonds” in English, consists of 32 members all hailing from the Cuzco area. Celia is 56 years old, married, and has two adult children (ages 30 and 36) who now have families of their own.

Celia runs a small restaurant out of her house where she sells “menús del día”, or daily set-priced lunches that usually consist of a soup, drink, and main dish. Celia says that she has a good base of clients that regularly come to eat at her restaurant. In addition to her restaurant business, Celia holds a job working in a clinical lab. 

Celia will use the Kiva loan to buy restaurant supplies for her business. She will also use part of the money to meet the monthly rent payments on her house, which she does not own herself. 

Celia is appreciative of and thankful for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To purchase restaurant supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase teak and eucalyptus wood

loans.name: Juan Aurelio

texts.es:
El señor Juan Aurelio tiene la edad de 49 años, es casado, tiene 2 hijas que están una en secundaria y la otra en escuela primaria, trabaja para la Alcaldía de Chichigalpa desde hace un año y se desempeña como gestor de proyectos, además él obtiene otros ingresos, ya que le trabaja al Ingenio san Antonio como contratista desde hace 2 años.
Don Aurelio ha obtenido 2 créditos con Ceprodel y los ha utilizado para mejoras de su vivienda ya que le quiere dar un mejor nivel de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Juan is 49 years old. He is married and has two daughters, one attends junior high school and one attends elementary school. He works as a project manager for the Chichigalpa city hall. He also receives additional income from his work as a contractor. He’s been doing this work for the past two years. Juan has had two previous loans through CEPRODEL which he has used to make improvements to his home and give his family a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building materials

loans.name: Edit Miriam

texts.en:
Edit Miriam is part of the Los Diamantes communal bank. This bank, whose name means “The Diamonds” in English, consists of 32 members all hailing from the Cuzco area. Edit Miriam is a 38-year-old single mother of one and lives in the city of Cuzco. Her son is currently enrolled in a local university and is studying systems engineering. 

Edit Miriam makes a living selling meat in the San Sebastian market in Cuzco. Here she owns a stand among other vendors. Edit Miriam will use her Kiva loan to invest in her meat business, buying more products to increase her sales. She will also use part of the loan to pay for her son’s university tuition. 

Edit Miriam is appreciative of and thankful for the loan, and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: Business capital and tuition payments

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel Godínez P. es un señor  de 54 años  de edad el cual vive con su esposa en una comunidad llamada Santa Fe localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa y por estar muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, caña de azúcar, naranja.

Desde hace ya varios años don Isabel  se dedica a su negocio, una Carnicería. Logra vender sus  productos a los vecinos de su comunidad quienes se muestran muy satisfechos con la calidad de sus productos en especial la carne de res. Don Isabel considera que gracias al progreso de este proyecto, él y su esposa han mejorado poco a poco sus condiciones de vida.

En estos momentos Don Isabel desea obtener un microcrédito  por ¢665000 (seiscientos sesenta y cinco mil colones), para comprar más vacas y cerdos  poder incrementar la ventas de su negocio. También necesita mejorar las condiciones del local ya  que se encuentra muy deteriorado y eso afecta las ventas. Asegura que su carniceria le ha dado muy buenos resultados y es por eso que necesita mejorarlo.


Isabel Godínez es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Manantial de Santa Fe, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su segundo  préstamo y con él espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito motivan a los microempresarios a seguir superándose.
texts.en:
Isabel Godínez P. is a 54 year old man who lives with his wife. They live in a community called Santa Fe, which is located in Los Chiles in the Alajuela province. This community is known for its mountainous regions and for being very close to the northern border of our country. Its main economic activities are livestock and farming. Specifically, they plant basic grains, sugar cane, and oranges. Isabel’s business for several years has been a butcher shop. He sells his products to the neighbors in his community. They are very satisfied with the quality of his products, especially the pork. Isabel believes that, thanks to the progress of this project, he and his wife have slowly improved their living conditions. At this time Isabel wishes to get a micro loan for ¢665,000 (six hundred sixty-five thousand colones) to buy more cows and pigs. He will buy them to increase sales in his business. He also needs to improve the conditions of his place because it is much deteriorated, and that affects sales. He assures us that his butcher shop has given him very good results. That is why he needs to improve it. Isabel Godínez is a member of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal Manantial (Manantial Communal Credit Company) in Santa Fe, one of a hundred member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his second loan. With the loan he hopes to grow more on a personal and economic level. He also points out that, thanks to this these types of organizations and ways of getting loans, small business people are motivated to keep improving themselves.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy livestock and improve his place

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase work materials and new sewing machines and open a workshop

loans.name: Magnolia

texts.en:
Magnolia is part of the Los Diamantes communal bank. This bank, whose name means “The Diamonds” in English, consists of 32 members all hailing from the Cuzco area. Magnolia is 36 years old and lives with her spouse and their two children, aged four and two months. 

Magnolia runs a restaurant business out of her house. When she first opened the restaurant, she only sold soups in the morning. She has recently expanded and is now open for lunch as well. During lunchtime she sells “menus del día”, a set-priced lunch that typically includes a soup, drink, and main dish. Magnolia also holds a job working in a clinical laboratory. 

Magnolia will use her Kiva loan to further improve her restaurant business. Magnolia is appreciative of and thankful for the loan, and promises to make the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: Restaurant Supplies

loans.name: Ana Geissel

texts.es:
La joven Ana Geissel tiene la edad de 22 años, es casada y con una carga familiar de 3 hijos varones de los cuales dos de ellos esta en edad escolar, su esposo es trabajador del Ingenio san Antonio desde hace 3 años y es obrero.. 
Ella se dedica desde hace 12 años a la venta de tortillas en el mercado municipal, y desde el año 2008 se le han financiado 9 créditos para compra de Maíz, leña, cal.
texts.en:
Ana is 22 years old. She is married and has three sons, two of whom are of school age. Her husband has been working as a laborer in San Antonio for the past three years and she has been selling tortillas in the municipal market for the past 12 years. She’s had nine loans since 2008, which she has used to buy corn, firewood and salt.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients

loans.name: Mujeres Con Propositos 1 Group

texts.en:
Ramona is a borrower who lives in Puerto Plata, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for her group, Mujeres con Propositos (Women with Plans), and her story is representative of those in her group and other Dominican and Haitian borrowers at Esperanza International.

Ramona lives with her husband and five children in a simple home in Puerto Plata, a medium sized town on the north coast of the Dominican Republic. Life in the Dominican Republic can be rough, with no potable running water, frequent power outages (if one has power to begin with), and inadequate access to healthcare, among other dangers. Despite these difficulties, Ramona runs a successful business running a small fried food stand in her community. She specializes in making empanadas. With this loan, she will be purchasing flour, oil, cheese, meats, and other foods to sell at her stand.

This is Ramona’s fourth loan with Esperanza International. With continued profits, she hopes to continue the growth of her business. Ramona will soon have enough money to purchase some appliances to make pastries, which will improve efficiency and increase her business profits. Her dream is to one day construct her house out of cement blocks instead of wood, giving her family more security against the weather and intruders. Ramona said “my loans have helped sustain my business and increased my income” and she now feels secure in the hope that her children will have a better future.

Esperanza International seeks to free children and their families through initiatives that generate income, education and health, restoring self-worth and dignity to those who have lost hope. We have over 8,500 active associates in eleven offices in the Dominican Republic and Haiti. Thank you for lending to Ramona and the Mujeres con Propositos group!

loans.use: Flour, oil, cheese, and meats for an empanada stand.

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
La Sra. A. G. Trabaja como asalariada en una Escuela que está ubicada en el municipio del viejo.
Ella va a utilizar el crédito en la compra de medicamentos para su papa ya que se encuentra muy enfermo y el resto en gastos personales.
A la fecha la Sra. A. ha tenido 8 créditos con CEPRODEL, los cuales todos los ha pagado en tiempo y forma por lo cual dice estar muy  agradecida con la Institución por todo el tiempo que la ha apoyado.
texts.en:
Ms. A. works in a school located in the city of Viejo. She is salaried. She will use some of the money from this loan to buy medication for her father who is very sick and will use the rest of money for personal expenses. She has had 8 previous loans through CEPRODEL, all of which she has repaid on time. She tells us that she is very thankful to the institution, which has always supported her.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Personal expenses

loans.name: Reina De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Reina de los Angeles C.  es una señora   de 45 años de edad la cual vive con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos en una comunidad llamada Coquital  localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa y por estar muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos y  naranja.

Desde hace ya 2 años Doña Reina  se dedica a la cría de pollos para engorde y gallinas ponedoras para la producción de carne y huevos, ella vende sus productos a los vecinos de su comunidad los cuales se muestran muy satisfechos. Ella dice que tener el apoyo y la ayuda de su esposo  le facilita seguir con el proyecto. Además dice que el proyecto le es muy interesante   ya que ha visto como poco a poco su negocio crece y la demanda cada vez es más fuerte.
 Actualmente doña Reina  está solicitando un micro crédito de ¢665.000 (seiscientos sesenta y cinco  mil colones) para la compra de más pollos y gallinas; concentrado, y productos para el tratamiento de enfermedades; además de ampliar y reforzar su local. Con esto ella espera hacer crecer más su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida. Su negocio va bien pero por falta de dinero no ha podido hacerlo crecer más. Con el préstamo que está solicitando espera aumentar las ventas y así mejorar la condición económica de su familia.

Ella forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Rapicrédito Progreso Futuro Coquital, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este es el segundo  crédito para doña Reina   y con el espera  sacarle un mejor provecho a su negocio y mejorar su condición económica.
texts.en:
Reina de los Angeles C. is a 45 year old woman who lives with her husband and their four children. They live in a community called Coquital, which is located in Los Chiles in the Alajuela province. This community is known for its mountainous regions and for being very close to the northern border of our country. Its main economic activities are livestock and farming. Specifically, they plant basic grains and oranges. For two years Reina has been raising chickens to fatten. She also raises laying hens to produce meat and eggs. She sells her products to the neighbors in the community, and they are very satisfied. She says that having her husband’s support and help facilitates the continuation of her project. She also says that the project is very interesting to her. She has seen her business slowly grow, and the demand is constantly increasing. Reina is currently requesting a loan for ¢665,000 (six hundred sixty-five thousand colones) to buy more chickens, hens, food concentrate, and products to treat illnesses. She also wants to expand and reinforce her place. She plans use the loan to make her business grow more and to improve her quality of life. Her business is going well, but she has not been able to make it grow more due to lack of money. With the requested loan she plans to increase sales and improve her family’s economic condition. She is part of the of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal Rapicrédito Progreso Futuro Coquital, which is one of a hundred member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This is Reina’s second loan. She plans to get a better profit from her business and to improve her economic condition.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chickens to fatten and to improve her place

loans.name: Clarisas Group

texts.es: El Grupo D. señoras  Clarisas, han tenido a bien acudir a la oficina D. ASDIR para tener apoyo, ya que ellas tienen  4 años atras luchando para la vida y realizando consturas y confecciòn D. delantales y fajas para damas y con ello salen a vender en los circunvecinos D. la localidad para sobre salir y quieren aumentar sus capital, ya que sus demanda a estado progresando y quieren tener mas ganancias y asi poder tener mejor nivel D. vida y por ello acuden, para ayudarse a ellas mismas  como tambien a sus hijos.-
texts.en:
The Clarisas group of women has done well by turning to the ASDIR office for help. For four years they fought for their lives making aprons and belts for women. They leave to sell in neighboring areas in order to do well. They want to increase their capital because the demand is increasing. They want to have more earnings in order to have a better standard of living. They is why they come to ASDIR, to be able to help themselves as well as their children.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: El Libertador Group

texts.es:
el grupo solidario El Libertador  esta ubicado en municipio de Agua Fria, Nacaome. A continuacion se detalla las diferentes actividades que ellas realizan:

la señora Nely G. tiene 58 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Celedonio Hernandez el se encuntra mal de salud, viven solos desde que fallecio su unico hijo, Nely tiene una pequeña pulperia en donde vende todo lo relacionado a la canasta familiar. utilizara el credito para surtir mas su negocio.
La sra. Andrea U. V. tiene 33 años de edad, vive con el señor Juan Carlos Manzanarez, el le ayuda con los gastos de alimentacion y otros gastos del hogar, el se dedica al albañileria, Andrea tiene un negocio de
 venta de golosinas en su casa, en donde vende tacos, tajaditas, enchiladas, refrescos. utilizara el credito para comprar materia prima para elaborar sus golosinas.
la señora Maria F. L. tiene 49 años de edad, es viuda y vive con su hija, tiene casa propia en donde tiene un pequeño taller de elaboracion de tortillas. Las vende a sus vecinos y personas aledañas al lugar, esta solicitando el credito para invertirlo en compra de maiz, leña.
texts.en:
The solitary Group, “El Libertador” (The Liberator) is located in Agua Fria Nacaome. Its members are involved in the following activities: Nely is 58 years old. She is married to Celedonio, who finds himself in poor health. They’ve been living alone since the death of their only son. Nely has a small general store where she sells a variety of pantry items. She is requesting this loan in order to be able to stock her business with a greater variety of products. Andrea is 33 years old and lives with Juan Carlos. He helps her with the food and household expenses and works as a mason. Andrea sells snacks out of her home. She sells tacos, chips, enchiladas, and soft drinks. She is requesting this loan in order to buy ingredients. Maria is 49 years old. She is a widow and lives with her daughter. She has her own home, where she runs a small tortilla making business. She sells them to her neighbors and people in the nearby regions. She is requesting this loan to buy corn and firewood.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients and supplies

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Las Morlaquitas (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Cuenca se unió un grupo de mujeres emprendedoras y decididas a sacar adelante a su familia y fundaron El Banco Comunal Las  Morlaquitas ubicado en la ciudad de Cuenca en la región centro sur del país, gozando de un clima frio propicio para  el cultivo de legumbres, frutas y maíz, también se caracteriza por la variedad de comida típica como las carnes asadas, cuyes y otras delicias propias de la región.En esta ocasión nos acompaña Deysi Ureña la promotora de crédito de éste banco, ella viste de café, tiene lentes y esta detrás  de la socia de rojo.
 
 La señora Silvia Arévalo vive en la casa de su esposo  en el sector Cristo del Consuelo  con sus dos hijos aun pequeños de siete años y 5 meses de nacido, su esposo se radico hace 20 años en el extranjero y como ya  tienen todos los papeles en regla viene cada cuatro meses a ver a su familia, nuestra socia tienen 28 años y es chofer profesional, conduce una camioneta de transporte escolar hace seis años, tiene dos recorridos el uno inicia a las 5 a.m. hasta las 8 a.m. en éste lleva niños de una escuela de la ciudad y el otro  es de 12 a.m. a 1p.m. con jóvenes de un colegio también de su localidad, estas actividades las comparte con los  quehaceres del hogar, el cuidado de sus hijos y los momentos libres teje carteras de nylon arte que aprendió hace diez años gracias a sus habilidades e imaginación.
  
Se encuentra en su segundo ciclo en la fundación motivada por una amiga  miembro del  bankito, con el dinero de su préstamo va a invertir en su auto en la compra de algunos repuestos y llantas y también para comprar nylon para seguir realizando sus carteras. Tiene como  meta comparase un auto pequeño para salir los fines de semana con sus hijos.

 María  Angeles M. es  otra de las socias del banco comunal Las Morlaquitas,  vive con cuatro de los seis hijos que concibió pues dos son casados y viven independientes, las edades oscilan entre los 33 y 14 años, solo su hijo menor aún estudia en un colegio nocturno y la mañana le ayuda en casa, todos sus hijos trabajan y le ayudan a solventar los gastos del hogar ya que ella tiene 51 años y está separada hace quince de su esposo.

Nuestra socia María Angeles labora 31 años en el mercado vendiendo frutas y hortalizas en su puesto  los días miércoles, sábados y domingos y los otros días lo hace en otro mercado recorriendo la P. para vender todo con un  horario de 6 a.m. a 7 p.m. esta actividad le ha permitido salir adelante con toda su familia.  Este es su primer crédito en la fundación y fue invitada por su nuera, con el dinero que obtenga comprará naranjas, naranjillas, melones, papayas, acelga, apio, zanahoria, cebolla, tomate y mas frutas y  hortalizas para surtir su negocio.

Su sueño es llegar a tener su casa propia que aún no la tiene.
texts.en:
In the city of Cuenca a group of enterprising and determined women united to advance their families, founding Las Morlaquitas Comunal Bank. It is located in Cuenca in the central south region of the country, enjoying a cold climate, appropriate for cultivation of vegetables, fruit and corn. It is also characterized by its variety of typical food, such as roast pork, guinea pig, and other delicacies of the region. On this occasion, we were accompanied by Deysi Ureña, the bank's credit promoter. In the photo she is wearing brown, has glasses, and is behind the member in red. Mrs. Silvia lives in her husband's house in the Cristo del Consuelo (Christ of Consolation) sector with her 2 children who are still small (7 years old and 5 months since birth). Her husband has resided abroad for 20 years and, now that he has his papers in order, he visits his family every 4 months. She is 28 years old and is a professional driver, who has been driving a school transport van for 6 years. She has 2 routes, one from 5:00 am until 8:00 am in which she brings young people to a school in the city, and the other from 12:00 am to 1:00 pm, with young people from a school in her locality. These activities she combines with household responsibilities, caring for her children, and in her free time, she makes artistic nylon purses, which she learned how to do 10 years ago, thanks to her abilities and imagination. She is in her 2nd loan cycle with the foundation, motivated by a friend and member of the little bank. With this loan she will invest in her vehicle, buying some replacement parts and tires and, also, buy nylon to continue making purses. Her goal is to buy a small auto to get away with her children on weekends. María Angeles is another member of the Las Morlaquitas bank. She lives with 4 of her 6 children, since 2 are married and living independently. Their ages are between 33 and 14. Only her youngest son still studies at night school and mornings he helps her in the house. All her children work and help to pay household expenses, since she is 51 and separated for 15 years from her husband. María has worked for 31 years in the market selling fruits and vegetables in her stall on Wednesdays, Saturdays, and Sundays. On other days, she does the same in another market, circulating in the P. selling everything between 6:00 am and 7:00 pm. This activity has permitted her family to get ahead. This is her first loan with the institution. She was invited to join by her daughter-in-law. With the funds she will buy citrus, melons, papayas, salt-wort, chicory, carrots, onions, tomatoes, and more fruits and vegetables to resupply her business. Her dream is to have a house which she still lacks.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING TIRES, VEHICLE PARTS, NYLON FOR PURSES, AND FRUITS AND VEGETABLES FOR HER BUSINESS

loans.name: Edison Emilio

texts.es:
Edison O. de 24 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Suburbio de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y cuenta con todos los servicios básicos.

El es chofer de un almacén de lunes a viernes pero por la falta de oportunidades y la desesperante idea de tener su propio negocio Edison compro $ 10.00 en pulseras y artesanías esto le genero ganancias y decidió que este iba a ser el negocio que tanto había estado esperando. 

En la actualidad el sigue siendo chofer pero trabaja los fines de semana y feriado vendiendo pulseras y artesanías así el tiene un ingreso adicional para sus gastos personales. Vende pulseras a $ 0.5, cadenas a $ 1.00 y anillos a  $ 1.00. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar pulseras, cadenas, anillos para su negocio. En el futuro quiere que su negocio siga prosperando y terminar la escuela de chefs.
texts.en:
Edison O. is 24 years old. He lives in an urban area in the suburb of Guayaquil. His house is made of cement and has all of the basic amenities. He is a driver for a store from Monday through Friday. Due to the lack of opportunities and the desperate wish to have his own buisiness, Edison bought $ 10.00 worth of bracelets and handicrafts. This generated some income for him and he decided that this what going to be the business he had been hoping for so much. At present, he is still a driver but he works on weekends and holidays selling bracelets and handicrafts. This way, he has additional income for his personal expenses. He sells bracelets for $.05, necklaces for $ 1.00, and rings for $ 1.00. With the loan he wants to buy bracelets, necklaces, and rings for his business. In the future, he wants his business to continue to prosper and to finish studying to be a chef.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bracelets, necklaces, rings

loans.name: José Patricio

texts.es:
El señor Patricio R. tiene la edad de 45 años, casado y con 3 hijas y 2 hijos todos en edad escolar, él es originario del pellizco Occidental ubicado a 4 km de Chichigalpa.
Don Patricio es trabajador de la Alcaldía Municipal de Chichigalpa desde hace 1 año y donde se desempeña como guarda de seguridad, desde el año 2006 trabaja con Ceprodel obteniendo hasta la fecha 6 créditos, cinco de ellos para mejoramiento de vivienda y el ultimo que lo solicito para pagar el alquiler de tierras y compra de insumos, ya que también se dedica a la agricultura.
texts.en:
Patricio is 45 years old, married and has 3 school-aged daughters and 2 sons. He is originally from an area 4km from Chichigalpa. For the past year he’s been working as a security guard for the Chichigalpa city hall. He has been affiliated with CEPRODEL since 2006 and has had six previous loans, five of which he used for home improvement, and the sixth to lease some land and buy farming supplies. He also works as a farmer.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Lease farmland and buy farming supples

loans.name: Gloria Catalina

texts.es: Doña Gloria es casada, tiene hijos y se dedica a la crianza de animales, vende güipiles, los cuales vende los dias martes, jueves y domingos. Ella solicita el crédito para comprar mas animales y material para hacer güipiles y asi poder continuar con su venta. El sueño de Doña Gloria es tener una granja.
texts.en:
Ms. Gloria is married with children. She raises animals and sells huipils which she sells on Tuesdays, Thursdays, and Sundays. She is asking for the loan to buy more animals and material to make huipiles and thus continue selling. Ms. Gloria's dream is to have a farm.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of animals and material to make huipiles

loans.name: Ileana Guadalupe

texts.es:
La Sra. G. B. es una profesora que trabaja en la Esc. Santa María de la Merced que esta ubicada en el municipio del Viejo, departamento de Chinandega.

Ella va a utilizar el crédito para pagar los gastos universitarios de su hija ya que esta en el último año de la Universidad y necesita para los gastos de la monografía.

Este es primer crédito que tiene con la Institución pero ella dice estar muy agradecida por la comprensión que le ha otorgado Ceprodel y espera seguir trabajando con nosotros.
texts.en:
Ms. G. is a profesional woman who works in the “Santa María de la Merced” school, in the city of Viejo, in the Chinandega department. She will use the money from this loan to pay university expenses for her daughter, now that she is in her final year. This will be her first loan through the institution, but she says that she is very grateful for CEPRODEL’s understanding and she hopes to be able to continue to work with us.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Tuition

loans.name: Victorias Group

texts.es: El grupo las victorias se na dedicado a la fabricaciòn y venta de delantales  y hace 5 años atras y con ello se an mantendio y han apoyado a sus hijos en la edad escolar, pero ellas quieren fabricar màs y tener a la venta  para cubrir la demanda por lo que acudieron a la ASOCIACIÒN ASDIR  para este apoyo y quieren tener màs capital para invertir en los delantales y asi superar y realizar sus sueños de esta en otro nivel de vida.
texts.en:
The Las Victorias group is dedicated to making and selling aprons. They have done this for five years and with it have supported themselves and their schoolage children. However, they want to make more and sell them to cover the demand. For this reason, they went to ASOCIACIÒN ASDIR for this support. They want to have more capital to invest in the aprons and in this way get ahead and have their dreams come true in another lifestyle.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital Application

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es: Catalina tiene 70 años, es viuda, tiene dos hijos ya adultos, de los cuales vive con uno de ellos, Alejandro, a quien le cedió parte de su casa, ubicado en un barrio, al sur de la ciudad de Lima.Desde 1980, trabaja en el comedor popular del estado, con su socia y vecina, de lunes a viernes, de 10:00am de la mañana hasta las 2:00pm de la tarde, en un local alquilado, a dos cuadras de su casa. Pero en vista que sus clientes buscaban otros gustos culinarios, se vio en la necesidad de preparar otros platillos en su casa, es así que desde las 6:00am de la mañana hasta las 8:00am cocina, para ofrecer estos nuevos platos, para aquellos que desee algo extra en la lista de menú, que normalmente ofrece, siendo al final recompensados en las ganancias. También vende queques y otras dulces, de esa manera obtienen un ingreso adicional. A ella le agrada la cocina y esta muy contenta el ritmo en que trabaja, por ser además rentable. Su anhelo es ser reconocida por su trabajo en el arte culinario, por que piensa hacer de ella su profesión y su único recurso de vida. Este será su diecinueve crédito con MFP, y en todo este tiempo ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable con el pago de sus cuotas. Además reconoce que se lleva bien con sus compañeras de su grupo comunal. El crédito que solicita, será para que pueda comprar productos e insumos para la preparación sus platillos.
texts.en:
Catalina is 70 years old. She is a widow with two adult children. One of them, Alejandro, lives with her. She let him have a part of her house, which is located in a neighborhood in the south of Lima. Since 1980, she has worked in a popular restaurant with her neighbor and partner. She works Monday through Fridays from 10:00 in the morning until 2:00 in the afternoon in a rented locale two blocks from her house. Seeing that her customers were looking for different culinary tastes, it became necessary to prepare different dishes at home. So, from 6:00 until 8:00 in the morning she cooks in order to offer these new dishes to those who wish for something different on the menu than what she normally offers. Later it is paid for with the earnings. She also sells cakes and other sweets and in this way obtains additional income. She likes to cook and she is very happy with the rythym of her work, besides the fact that it is profitable. Her wish is to be recognized for her work in culinary arts, because she plans on making it her profession and her only means of support. This will be her nineteenth loan with MFP and this whole time she has shown herself to be a very responsible person in making her payments. In addition, she acknowledges that she gets along well with the other members of her communal group. The loan that she is asking for will be for her to purchase products and ingredients to prepare her dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Products and ingredients to continue preparing her dishes.

loans.name: Sonia Verónica

texts.es: Sonia X., soletera de 25 años de edad, vive con su hermana gemela. Ella se dedica a elaborar y vender güipiles tipicos, trabaja medio tiempo en el sanatorio de la comunidad como Enfermera Auxiliar, siempre ayuda a la comunidad prestando sus servicios cuando pacientes o vecinos solicitan de sus servicios. Sonia solicita el crédito para la compra de cortes, fajas y blusas típicas y asi poder poner una tienda de trajes típicos, y asi poder obtener mejores ganancias y la oportunidad de tener una vida mejor al lado de su hermana.
texts.en:
Sonia Xicayl is 25 years old and single. She lives with her twin sister. She makes and sells huipils (traditional Guatemalan blouses). She works half time in the community sanatorium as an auxiliary nurse. She always helps the community, lending her services when patients or neighbors ask for them. Sonia is applying for the loan to buy fabric, sashes, and typical blouses so that she can set up a shop of typical clothing and thus be able to have better earnings and the opportunity to have a better life at the side of her sister.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in merchandise for a shop selling typical clothing

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Alicia, de 60 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposo, que es profesor, pues sus hijos son mayores y viven independientes.Le dedica la mayor parte de su tiempo a su negocio de venta de productos de belleza. Alicia lleva casi 3 años dedicándose a esta actividad, y durante todo este tiempo le ha ido muy bien gracias al buen trato que les brinda a sus clientes, además porque sabe  administrar muy bien sus ingresos. Pero esa no es la única actividad a la que se dedica ya que también por las mañanas es la cocinera y organizadora del “comedor popular” (lugar donde se venden platos de comida a bajos precios) de su localidad. Alicia se siente contenta con su trabajo ya que es muy útil y productiva. En el  futuro quiere instalar  un bazar o un restaurante en su casa, ya que las dos actividades le gustan mucho y aun no se define por una de ellas.Es el  segundo préstamo que tiene y se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, además esta  muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando.El dinero solicitado  lo invertirá en la compra de gran cantidad de  productos de belleza para tenerlos en stock pues  ya  tiene varios pedidos, y quiere cumplir con todos.
texts.en:
Alicia, who is 60 years old, lives in her own house with her husband, who is a teacher. Their children are grown and live on their own. She dedicates the majority of time to her business, which is selling beauty products. Alicia has made her living with this business for almost 3 years, and it's gone very well for her this whole time thanks to the good service she provides to her customers. Furthermore, she knows how to manage her income quite well. But that is not the only business from which she makes her living; in the mornings she is the organizer and cook at the "comedor popular” (a place where low-cost plates of food are sold) in her town. Alicia feels happy with her work because it is useful and productive. In the future, she wants to open a corner store or a restaurant in her home, since she likes both businesses very much and still hasn't chosen one over the other. This is the second loan she has received, and she promises to be timely in her payments. In addition, she is very grateful to all those who made the loan possible; it will allow her to continue working. The money she requested will be invested in the purchase of a large quantity of beauty products so she can have them in stock. She already has several orders and would like to fill them all.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will purchase beauty product merchandise

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.es:
La señora Rosa D.es soltera y con una carga familiar de 3 hijas y un hijo varón, 3 de ellos están estudiando en la secundaria. Ella es comerciante desde hace 13 años y se dedica a la venta de queso en el mercado municipal. 
Trabaja con Ceprodel desde hace 4 años obteniendo hasta la fecha 14 créditos los cuales han sido para invertir en el negocio
texts.en:
Rosa is single and has three daughters and one son. Three of her children attend junior high school. She’s been in business for the past 13 years and sells cheeses in the municipal marketplace. She has been working with CEPRODEL for the past four years and has had 14 previous loans which she has used to invest into her business.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cheeses

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es: Candida Rosa tiene 43 años, su actividad económica es una pulpería además de tener este negocio también se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio en donde ofrece todo tipo de productos como es carne, pollo, gaseosa, detergente, pan, refrescos naturales. Ella tenía una fuente de ingresos necesaria para su hogar pues tiene 4 hijos a su cargo, por lo que siempre le ha gustado trabajar y ser una persona independiente. El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima. Su deseo es proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Candida Rosa is 43 years old and she works at her grocery store. In addition to this business she also sells general merchandise. She has had this business for the last 10 years, she offers all types of products such as meats, poultry, sodas, detergents, bread and natural beverages. She needs this source of income because she is in charge of 4 children, also she likes to work and be independent. The loan is to increase her working capital in the purchase of raw materials. Her wishes are to make improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ana Cristina

texts.es:
La Sra. F. E.  es una profesora que trabaja en la Esc. Santa María de la Merced que está ubicada en el municipio del Viejo, departamento de Chinandega.

Ella va a utilizar el crédito para poner el piso de su casa ya que esta recién hecha y le faltan algunos detalles.

Ella es madre soltera de 2 niños pequeños ya que los demás ya son mayores de edad y gracias a su trabajo a podido salir adelante con ellos y educarlos, además vende nacatamales los fines de semana en su casa para tener mayores ingresos.

Este es tercer  crédito que tiene con la Institución los cuales  siempre los han pagado muy bien en tiempo y forma y dice estar muy agradecida por ayudarla y brindarle apoyo cuando ella necesita.
texts.en:
Ms. F. is a teacher at the “Santa María de la Merced” located in Viejo. She will use the money from this loan to install a floor in her home, which is newly built but missing a few details. She is the single mother of two small children. The others are fully grown. Thanks to her work she has been able to get ahead and provide them with an education. She also sells nacatamales out of her home on the weekend for extra income. This is the third loan she has gotten through the institution and she has always been timely with her payments. She is very grateful for the assistance and support.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home Improvement

loans.name: Las Chapinitas Group

texts.es: El grupo las Chapinitas, se han dedicado a la compra y venta de ropa y mostacillas para artesanias y ellas han trabajado durante 7 años, estas mujeres trabajadoras y enprendedoras en la artesania y en la venta de ropa tipica nueva y usada, para damas y con este tipo de trabajo ae han ganado la vida y  siguen apoyando a sus hijos e hijas para tener una buena escolaridad para defenderse de la viad  segun relatan ellas y asi tambien pueden superarse en la vida y viendo la gran necesidad de ampliar su negocio acuden a la ASOCIACION  ASDIR para este apoyo y quieren capitalizar  y a si comprar mas mercaderia y tener màs ganancias, y tener superaciòn en la vida.
texts.en:
The Chapinitas group buys and sells clothes and beads for handicrafts. They have been doing this for 7 years. These hardworking and enterprising women work in handicrafts and the sale of new and used traditional clothing for women. With this work, they have earned their living and continue to support their daughters and sons in order for them to have a good education and fend for themselves in life and get ahead. Seeing a great need to grow their business, they have gone to ASOCIACION ASDIR for this support. They want to capitalize and in this way purchase more merchandise, make more profit, and get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital Application

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es: Graciela, de 48 años, vive en su casa propia  con su hija Pamela  (20) y su nieto Cristopher (3).Desde hace 2 años, se dedica a la venta de medias y lencería, pero es comerciante hace muchos años atrás , antes tenia un puesto de venta de verduras, al cual tuvo que renunciar porque padeció de una enfermedad que no le permitía hacer mucho esfuerzo físico y  esa labor  requería cargar costales y acomodarlos. Es así que optó por una labor más tranquila y que pudiera realizarla durante las tardes, ya que  también cuida a su nieto por las mañanas. Su forma de trabajo la realiza de la siguiente manera, ofrece  su mercadería de casa en  casa a sus vecinas y amigas, luego ellas le hacen los  pedidos de las prendas que les gustaron. Después de unos días trae con seguridad la cantidad y el modelo que ellas escogieron haciendo una venta segura. En el  futuro tiene planeado instalar  un bazar en su casa y en el  desarrollo de este proyecto también la ayudará su hija.Es su primer préstamo y promete ser muy puntual con el pago de sus  cuotas, además agradece a todas aquellas personas que hicieron posible el dinero del crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando.Graciela tiene pensado invertir  el dinero solicitado  en la  compra de mayor cantidad de medias, pues ya tiene varios pedidos que cumplir.
texts.en:
Graciela is 48 years old. She lives in her own home with her daughter Pamela (20) and her grandson Cristopher (3). For the last two years, she has been selling socks and lingerie, but she has been a merchant for many years. Previously, she had a stall selling vegetables. She had to give this up because she suffered from a disease that didn't allow her to exert herself very much physically and that job required picking up and arranging sacks. This is why she decided on a job that was calmer and that she could do afternoons, since she also takes care of her grandson mornings. She works in the following way: she offers her merchandise door to door to her neighbors and friends. Later they order the clothes that they like. After a few days guaranteed, she brings the quantity and style that they have chosen and she makes a guaranteed sale. in the future she plans on having a convenience store in her house and her daughter will also help develop this project. This is her first loan and she promises to make her payments very punctually. In addition, she is very grateful to all the people who made the money for this loan possible, which will allow her to keep working. Graciela is planning on investing the requested money in buying alarger quantity of socks, since she has several orders to fill.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy merchandise in a variety of socks.

loans.name: Ana Balbina

texts.es: Esta Señora es originaria del Municipio de Cinco Pinos, Departamento de Chinandega, solicita un crédito para mejorar su negocio, la cual fue destinado para compra de materiales de construcción, tales como cemento, tubos, laminas de zinc, y herramientas, la cual le ha servido para prosperar su negocio y asi vivir dignamente.
texts.en:
This lady is originally from "Cinco Pinos." She is asking for this loan in order to improve her business. She will buy building materials and tools in order to improve her business and live with dignity.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building materials and tools

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.es:
Primitiva pertenece al banco comunal “Reyna D. los Ángeles”, es natural D. Urubamba, tiene 67 años, tiene nueve hijos. Ella es una madre responsable que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus menores hijos. 

Primitiva se dedica a la venta D. verduras, frutas y maíz blanco, ella los días lunes, miércoles y sábados lleva a vender sus productos a la ciudad del Cusco al mercado D. Huancaro. La socia nos cuenta que tiene clientes fijos que le hacen pedido D. maíz blanco pues su producto es D. calidad  y sus clientes se encuentran contentos por los prodcutos que compran. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.

Primitiva requiere el préstamo para comprar frutas como por ejemplo blanquillo y durazno.     

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Primitiva belongs to the communal bank “Reyna D. los Ángeles”. She is from Urubamba. She is 67 years old and has nine children. She is a responsible mother who is always looking for opportunities to get ahead and with her determination give a better furture to her younger children. Primitiva sells vegetables, fruit and white corn. On Mondays, Wednesdays and Saturdays she takes her products to the Huancaro market in Cuzco. This member tells us that she has regular customers who order white corn from her because her product is of good quality and her customers are happy with the products they buy from her. She has been at this business for several years and it has gone well for her thanks to the dedication she puts into her work. Primitiva needs the loan to buy fruit such as grapes and peaches. This member is grateful for the opportunity offered in this way and she is also dedicated to making the payments according to schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Primitiva needs the loan to buy fruit such as grapes and peaches

loans.name: Gladis Xiomara

texts.es:
la sra. Gladis Xiomara A. M. tiene 16 años de dedicarse al comercio y es notable que durante todo este tiempo a sabido administrar su negocio ya que sus condiciones de vida han mejorado.
Doña Gladis es la propietaria de la caseta que se encuentra ubicada dentro de la Escuela “MANUEL DE ADALID Y GAMERO” misma que se encuentra ubicada en el centro de esta ciudad, aqui se imparten clases en dos jornadas: matutina y vespertina, dicho centro de estudio cuenta con una asistencia de 750 alumnos promedio diarios.
Doña Gladis no cuenta con competencia de negocio dentro de la escuela, ya que es la única cafetería de la escuela y por seguridad de los alumnos tampoco los dejan salir a comprar afuera del centro de estudios.
Doña Gladis esta casada y con su esposo han procreado 3 hijos los cuales dependen de ellos al 100%; su esposo trabaja para el ministerio de salud pública como promotor de salud.
