Ella inicio hace 16 años con este negocio por que la situación económica para ellos era bien difícil en aquel entonces, pero con las ganancias que su negocio le a dejado han logrado cubrir varios gastos que se han dado dentro del hogar.

Doña Gladis Invertirá su crédito en la compra de Refrescos, churros, confites, paletas, chicles, galletas, jugos, tortillas de harina, frijoles, pan.
texts.en:
Gladis Xiomara A. M. has been a merchant for 16 years. It is notable that during this time she has known how to administer her business, and her living conditions have improved. Gladis is the proprietor of a stand located in the Manuel de Adalid y Gamero School, which is in the center of the city. Classes are given in two sessions, mornings and evenings. An average of 750 students attends this educational center daily. Gladis does not have any business competition within the school because it is the only café in the school. For security reasons, students are not allowed to leave the educational center to shop elsewhere. Gladis is married. She and her husband have three children who are 100% dependent upon them. Her husband works in the Ministry of Public Health as a health advocate. She started her business 16 years ago because their economic situation was very difficult. With the earnings from her business they have been able to cover various household expenses. Gladis will use the loan to buy soft drinks, churros, candy, lollipops, gum, cookies, juice, flour tortillas, beans, and bread.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tortillas, doughnuts, meat, salsa, soft drinks, churros, candy, lollipops, gum, cookies, juice, flour tortillas, beans, and bread

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es: La señora Teodora L. tiene 57 años de edad, es madre soltera de 3 hijos mayores de edad, que ya vive aparte. Ella se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general como vestuario, productos de belleza y productos varios como cobertores, sabanas. Ella realiza sus compras solamente por encargos, es decir cuando ya tiene bastantes pedidos. Ella inicio con este negocio desde hace 11 años, esto fue debido a la falta de empleo, y actualmente este negocio constituye la mayor fuente de ingresos de su familia. Ella actualmente está solicitando un crédito en Fundación León 2000 para ser invertido en la compra de mercadería nueva, esto con el objetivo de aprovechar las ventas de verano que se acercan. Desea diversificar su inventario comprando trajes de baño, protector solar. Algo que la afecta durante algunos periodos del año, es que las ventas se disminuyen, por lo que ella aprovecha cuando vienen las épocas buenas para invertirle más a su negocio. El sueño consiste en continuar creciendo en su negocio y de esta manera ampliar las instalaciones en las cuales actualmente tiene localizado su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Teodora L. is 57 years old, a single mother of 3 grown children that live on their own. She sells general merchandise such as clothing, beauty products and other products as comforters and sheets. She buys only when she has enough orders. She started in this business 11 years ago because she could not find a job, currently this is the major source of income for her family. She is requesting a loan at the Fundación León 2000 for the purchase of new merchandise and to be able to take advantage of the upcoming summer sales. She wants to vary her inventory by purchasing bathing suits and sun screens. At times during the year her sales taper off, so she takes advantage of the good selling seasons to invest in her business. Her dream is to continue growing her business and enlarge the space where her business is located.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Tansito's Group

texts.es: Este pequeño grupo de Mujeres  luchadoras para el  bien  comun de ellas y para su familia an  estado trabajando para la superaciòn en la compra y venta de ropa tipica  ya que sus ansestro les enseñaron a realizar este tipo de trabajao y lo cual ellas se handedicado durante 9 años atras y estan comercializando en varias lugares de Guatemala con este producto de ropa tipica y van en lugar en lugar para ganar el pan de cada dia y ellas relatan que estan llevando màs mercaderia surtida para combatir la competencia pero les hace falta capital de trabajo y por lo cual acuden a la Asociaciòn de ASDIR para apollarlas en sus capitales y asi prosperar este año y darles lo mejor a sus familias.-
texts.en:
This small group of women is struggling for the common good of themselves and their families. They have been working to succeed in the business of buying and selling traditional Guatemalan clothing. Their parents taught them to do this kind of work, which they have been carrying out for 9 years. They sell this product of traditional clothing in various locations in Guatemala, going from place to place to earn their daily bread. They tell us that they are stocking more merchandise to sell in order to compete in the market, but they lack working capital and for this reason they came to the Asociaciòn ASDIR to support them with capital so that they can prosper this year and give the best for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital to buy traditional Guatemalan clothing

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ulises

texts.es:
El señor Ulises H. es casado, tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar, su esposa es maestra de educación primaria.
Don Ulises es trabajador de la Alcaldía Municipal de Chichigalpa desde hace 13 años desempeñándose como conductor de una unidad recolectora de basura.
A él se le han otorgado 5 créditos los cuales han sido para mejoramiento de vivienda y este ultimo que es para gastos médicos y otros gastos.
Él nos expresa que han sido de mucha ayuda, ya que le han permitido dar un mejor nivel de vida a su familia
texts.en:
Sr. Ulises H. is married and has two school age children. His wife is an elementary school teacher. Don Ulises has been working for the Chichigalpa municipal government for 13 years as a garbage truck driver.

He has received five previous loans which were used for making improvements to his home. This latest loan will be used for medical and other related expenses. Ulises says the loans have been very helpful because they have allowed him to provide his family with a better standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Medical and other related expenses (such as buying medicines)

loans.name: Martha Marina

texts.es:
doña Martha Marina E. tiene 50 años de edad, esta casada con Jose Ramon Valladares, es madre de 3 hijos ya adultos. Martha se dedica a atender su pulperia la cual tiene muchos años de tenerla, con esta actividad y la ayuda de su esposo han salido adelante en su hogar.
Martha Utilizara el credito para poder surtir un poco mas su negocio y con ello tener un margen mejor de ganancias.
texts.en:
Martha Marina E. is 50 years old. She is married to Jose Ramon Valladares, and she has three grown children. Martha has had a mini-market for many years. Through this activity she helps her husband, and they have gotten ahead in their household. Martha will use the loan to stock her business a little more. That way she will have a greater margin of earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, beans, sugar, toilet paper, soft drinks, tortillas, bread, cookies, churros, candy, shortening, spaghetti, salsas, oil, salt, coffee, bread, soup, locks, matches, and soaps

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan G. de 25 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Perimetral de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. 

El padre de Juan tenía el sueño de tener su propio asadero de pollo. Juan con los pocos ahorros que tenía decidió hacer realidad el sueño de su padre comprando un pequeño asadero. 

Ahora el tiene un local alquilado con un empleado trabajando y su horario es de 09:00 am hasta las 21:00 pm. En su asadero vende pollos enteros con ensalada y colas a $ 9.00. Con el préstamo quiere comprar pollos, bebidas y víveres para su asadero de pollos. 

En el futuro quiere comprar su propia casa y hay adecuar el asadero.
texts.en:
Juan G. is 25 years old and lives on the outskirts of Guayaquil, Ecuador. His house is made of cement and has basic services such as water and electricity. Juan's father always wanted to have his own chicken roasting business. Using the few savings he had, Juan decided to make his father's dream a reality by buying a small roaster. He now rents a space and works from 9:00 AM to 9:00 PM along with one other employee. In his small restaurant he sells whole roasted chickens with a salad and a drink for $9.00. With this loan he wants to buy chickens, drinks, and other supplies for his business. In the future he wants to buy his own house and improve his business.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Chickens, drinks

loans.name: María Luisa

texts.es:
La señora M. V.  realiza venta de tortilla en su casa desde las 5 am inicia preparando el producto para la fabricación de tortilla que es realizada en dos  turnos de 10 am  - 12pm, y por la tarde 4:00 am – 6pm.

Este crédito que solicito es  para la compra por mayor de los productos a utilizar en la elaboración de tortilla aprovechando que se encuentra con precios accesible. De esta manera obtener mayor ganancia para una mejor situación económica.

 La Señora M. V. está  muy satisfecha con el apoyo que le ha brindado Ceprodel por que ha logrado el crecimiento de su negocio y mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Sra. M. V. sells tortillas from her home. She starts preparing the ingredients at 5am and then makes the tortillas in two shifts – from 10am to 12pm, and in the afternoon from 4pm to 6pm.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy products in bulk that she uses for making tortillas. She wants to take advantage of discounted prices so that she can generate better earnings and improve her financial situation.

Sra. M. V. is very satisfied with the support CEPRODEL has provided by helping her grow her business and improve her home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase corn, firewood, and lime

loans.name: Henry Alberto

texts.es: El cliente es originario del municipio de Cinco Pinos y el crédito será destinado para mejorar su negocio, compra de enseres domésticos, tales como: aceite, arroz, frijoles, maíz, golosinas, cajas de jabón de baño, de lavar, y está caracterizado por ser buen cliente ya que cumple en tiempo y forma la cancelación de su crédito.
texts.en:
Henry Alberto is originally from the town of Cinco Pinos. This loan will be used to improve his business by purchasing household goods such as oil, rice, beans, corn, candy, cases of bath soap, and cleansers. He is known for being a good client who completes his loan payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to improve his business

loans.name: Catarina's Group

texts.es: Las señoras Trabajadoras que se han dedicado a la compra y venta de ropa tipica  ellas  han tenido a bien de trabajar durante 5 años atras ya que con esto se han mantenido y han mantenido a sus hijos y familia salen  a vender  cortes y guipiles  a otras aldeas  aledaños para ganar el sustento, y para tener màs surtido la mercaderia acuden a la Asociacicòn ASDIR para incrementar sus capitales y asi sobre salir avante a la competencia y generar màs ganancia y podran estar en otro nivel de vida  de ellas y de sus familia.
texts.en:
The Lady Workers have worked buying and selling traditional clothing. They have had to work hard during the last 5 years so that they could support themselves and their families and children. They travel to sell traditional blouses and skirts to other nearby villages to earn their upkeep. In order to have more stocked merchandise they have come to the ASDIR association to ask for a loan to increase their capital so that they can get ahead of the competition and generate more earnings and be able to be at a higher level for themselves and their families.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase capital

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel tiene 63 años, es divorciada hace 23 años, pero de aquel matrimonio, tuvo tres hijos, adultos e independientes, por el que solo vive con su hija y su esposo en su casa, ubicado en un barrio al sur de Lima. Se dedica al negocio de venta de productos de primera necesidad, establecimiento que se encuentra en el primer piso de su casa, por lo que ya lleva dieciséis años en este negocio. Desde entonces atiende con mucha amabilidad a cada uno de sus clientes, ya que sin ellos, no hubiera crecido su bodega y no hubiera percibido mas rentas. Es así que abre su tienda a las 6:00am de la mañana hasta altas horas de la noche, y cuando  se va a comprar más mercadería, su hija se encarga de la venta de bebidas, por lo que Isabel regresa prontamente a su casa, ya que no le gusta mantener cerrado su negocio.  Su mayor anhelo es que su bodega esté repleta de varios productos,  asimismo quiere arreglar las fisuras de las paredes de su casa, provocado por un  movimiento sísmico. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, además como líder de su grupo comunal, incentivará a todas sus compañeras que sean también puntuales en sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de diversos productos para abastecer su bodega, asimismo desea derivar parte del crédito en la compra de materiales de construcción para arreglar su casa.
texts.en:
Isabel is 63 years old and has been divorced for 23 years, but from that marriage she has 3 children who are independent adults. She lives alone with her daughter and new husband in her own home in a neighborhood in the south of Lima. She runs her own business selling groceries and staples in a store built in the first floor of her house. She has run this business for 16 years. Since then she has attended to her every one of her customers with a lot of friendliness because without them she would not have been able to grow her inventory and her profits. For this reason she opens her store at 6am until late at night. When she leaves to buy merchandise, her daughter is in charge of selling beverages. She always hurries home because they do not like to leave the business closed. Her greatest wish is to have her warehouse full of various products. She also would like to fix the cracks in the wall of her house that were caused by an earthquake. This is her 6th loan cycle with MFP and she agrees to pay her account punctually. As leader of the group, she will also encourage all of her colleagues to be punctual with their payments as well. She is asking for a loan to buy various products to stock her warehouse and to buy construction materials to fix her house.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy products to stock her warehouse

loans.name: Mercedes De Los Santos

texts.es:
La señora Mercedes  se dedica a la venta de granos básicos, frutas y verdura inicia a ofertar la variedad de producto desde las 5:00am,  su tramo está ubicado en el mercado la terminal. 

Este crédito lo solicita para comprar producto al por mayor con el objetivo de obtener mayores ganancias con el fin de mejorar su nivel de vida y la de su familia.
Se siente muy agradecida con el apoyo que le ha brindado Ceprodel pues inicio con venta de verdura y hoy en día a logrado ampliar su negocio teniendo la venta de granos básico.
texts.en:
Sra. Mercedes sells basic grains, fruits, and vegetables. She begins offering her variety of products at 5am from her vending post in the terminal market.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy products in bulk so that she can generate better earnings and improve her family’s standard of living. She is very grateful for the assistance CEPRODEL has provided in starting her vegetable stand. Today she has managed to grow her business by adding the sale of basic grains.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, beans, oil, corn, and bananas

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.es: Hilaria de 49 años, vive en su casa propia  al lado de su esposo Máximo (47) y sus hijas Mónica (28) y Erika (17).Se dedica a la venta de comida en su carrito salchipapero (especial para freír), trabaja durante las noches y durante las mañanas también vende comida en su restaurante, que  esta ubicado en su  casa. Hilaria se dedica 7 años a este rubro, y su sazón atrae el gusto de muchos comensales a diario. Siempre le ha gustado cocinar pues aprendió desde muy joven todos lo secretos para la preparación de las diferentes comidas, por eso esta muy orgullosa por lo logrado ya que cuando comenzó no tenía nada, y poco a poco fue mejorando  su negocio. Hilaria se esfuerza mucho por progresar  cada día y en el futuro tiene planeado instalar un  restaurante bien equipado y cómodo para el bienestar de su clientela.Es el segundo préstamo que tiene y esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando.Hilaria tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de  arroz y  azúcar, al por mayor, también contratara personal para la refacción  de algunos espacios de su restaurante.
texts.en:
Hilaria is 49 years old and lives in her own home with her husband Maximo, who is 47 and her daughters Monica (28) and Erika (17). She works selling sausages and fried potatoes from a food cart at night. In the mornings she sells food from her restaurant, which is located in her home. Hilaria has worked in this area for 7 years and her special seasoning attracts many customers daily. She has always enjoyed cooking and learned from a very young age all the secrets of preparing different foods. For this reason she is very proud to have achieved this, when she started from nothing and little by little she improved her business. Hilaria makes an effort to progress every day and in the future she has plans to install a well-equipped and comfortable restaurant for the well-being of her customers. This is the second loan she has applied for and she is very grateful to all the people that have made it possible to obtain credit to permit her to continue working. Hilaria has plans to invest the money in the purchase of rice and sugar wholesale and also to recruit staff for the refurbishment of some areas in her restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase inventory and make improvements to the place of business

loans.name: María Adela

texts.es:
La señora L. Trabaja brindando servicio odontológico, en un consultorio asociado con otro Dr. Donde atiende a su clientela en dos turnos 8:00 am – 12pm. Y 2:00pm – 5:00pm. 

El crédito que ha solicitado es para mejora de vivienda con el objetivo de acondicionarla e instalar su propio consultorio para brindarle a su clientela mejores condiciones y por ende obtener mayores ganancias lo que ayudaría a mejorar su nivel de vida la de su familia. 
 Cabe mencionar que en los créditos anteriores la Sra. L. eran invertido para capital de trabajo ya que se dedicaba también a  la compra y venta de granos básicos al por mayor. Por lo que se siente agradecida con el apoyo que le ha brindado ceprodel ya que con las ganancias ha mejorado poco a poco su vivienda.
texts.en:
Sra. L. provides dental services in an office shared with another dentist. She attends to her patients from 8am to 12pm and from 2pm to 5pm.

The loan she is requesting will be used to make improvements to her home with the goal of making it suitable for establishing her own dental clinic. She hopes to provide her patients with better conditions so that she can generate more income to help improve her family’s standard of living. It should be mentioned that her previous loans were used as operating capital since she also buys and sells basic grains in bulk.

Sra. L. is very grateful for the support CEPRODEL has provided. With her earnings, she has slowly been able to make improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ceramic tiles & cement

loans.name: Cesar Augusto

texts.es: El cliente es originario del municipio de Cinco Pinos, el crédito será destinado para mejorar su vivienda, compra de zinc, bolsas de cementos y ladrillos, asi vivir dignamente en su casa. Agradece mucho ya que le ha servido para que su familia tenga un techo donde vivir. Ha pagado en tiempo y forma sus cuotas.
texts.en:
The client is from the Cinco Pinos municipality. The loan is to make improvements on his house. He will buy zinc, bags of cement, and bricks. That way he will live decently in his house. He is very grateful because the loan has served to give his family a roof over their heads. He has paid on time and as agreed upon.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction material

loans.name: Rosalio

texts.es:
Rosalio, tiene 46 años, es natural de la ciudad de Yucay y pertenece al banco comunal “REYNA DE LOS ANGELES” de la Asociación Arariwa, él socio tiene un hijo llamado Juan Carlos que tiene 14 años.  

Rosalio es un padre trabajador y responsable y que se dedica a transportar productos de las Ciudades de Urubamba a Cusco y viceversa, él nos cuenta que los días martes, jueves y sábado su actividad comercial empieza, cuando a las 9 de la noche la dueña de la mercadería hace cargar sus verduras. El socio sale de la ciudad de Urubamba  a las 10  de la noche y llega a la ciudad del Cusco a las 11 de la noche, él socio hace descarga los productos hasta las 2 o 3 de la madrugada y después él socio se va a dormir. El socia regresa al día siguiente a la ciudad de Urubamba llevando comestibles como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos, etc. El anhelo del socio es comprarse una casa en la ciudad de Yucay y un camión, él para lograr sus sueños esta ahorrando.

El socio requiere el préstamo para comprar comestibles como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar y fideos. 

El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Rosalio is 46 years old, is a native of the city of Yucay and belongs to the community bank Reyna de los Angeles of the Arariwa Association. He has a son called Juan Carlos who is 14 years old. Rosalio is a hard working and responsible father who works transporting goods from the city of Urubamba to Cusco and vice versa. He tells us that on Tuesdays, Thursdays and Saturdays his commercial activity begins when at 9pm the owner of the shop loads her vegetables. He leaves the city of Urubamba at 10pm and arrives in Cusco at 11pm. He unloads the merchandise until 2 or 3 am, and after that he sleeps. He returns the following day to the city of Urubamba carrying groceries such as rice, sugar, noodles, etc. He wishes to buy a house in the city of Yucay and a truck. To achieve his dreams he is saving. This member needs the loan to buy groceries for example rice, sugar and noodles. He is very grateful for the opportunity provided and promises to comply with the payment schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy groceries such as rice, sugar, and noodles.
